TEXT.English: Decius returns home and spends a night feasting and telling tales with the men of his Father's holdings. Rosier's parting words haunt him, however, and he retires early. From under his bed comes an inky black snake, hissing and swaying as it crawls up him. Decius tries to grab it but cannot move, and the snake speaks to him. "Noble one... you serve loyally and unquestioningly. How is your service repaid? Such a hard life. Surely such skill and valor as yours should be better rewarded. You deserve power and wealth beyond your station. Is honor such a dear currency to you?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Finally Decius finds his voice. "Away!" He reaches for the snake, but it slithers away, under his bed. Decius reaches for it, finally grasping the thing and strangling it with his bare hands until...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Until he awakes to his father's voice. "Are you alright my son... Decius, by god, what are you doing?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius is on his knees with his hands wrapped around an octopus-headed idol which glows faintly in the dark.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I had a nightmare. A demon was tempting me, and..."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And it looks to me like you gave in. I would have never thought you capable of this blasphemy. But nor would I have suspected Rosier, either. We shall leave this for the Confessors to determine."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have seen how the Order judges, and would ask you to trust your own judgment. Trust your own son!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I must rather trust my own eyes, Decius."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Then I guess I must trust my feet, Lord Commander." Decius swung, smacking his father with the idol. His father staggered back, and Decius rushed past, heading for the stables before alarm could be given.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He was a fugitive, which is almost as bad as a confession. He would have no succor within the Empire. And the Empire's reach was well beyond its borders-forts lie north, east, and south. And to the west lie the Lanun. He almost stopped. He believed in law, in order, he had sworn his life to the unending crusade against evil. A hundred times he had risked that life on the field of battle. But he would not die the heretic's death, reviled and anathematized.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The diviners would not look at his valorous history, nor could they what had actually happened. They would look into his heart, and read any doubt as disloyalty.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He spurred his horse toward the west.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When he arrived in Innsmouth there was a ship heading across the great sea, carrying spices, furs, and slaves. He was recognized as their enemy-but not, to his luck, as their commander. His horse, and the bit of gold he had in her saddlebag bought him one way passage, no questions asked. Or just one question.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We go to the desert of Myrh, Bannorman. We can let you off with the Calabim, or you can hire a guide to take you to a Malakim city. What is your choice?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](The civilization you choose will determine what civilization you play as in future scenarios)

TEXT.English: I will go to the Calabim. Better to hide where the so-called righteous fear to tread. Among the feared Calabim I can make my way less encumbered by the laws that have bound me to now.
TEXT.French: I will go to the Calabim. Better to hide where the so-called righteous fear to tread. Among the feared Calabim I can make my way less encumbered by the laws that have bound me to now.
TEXT.German: Ich werde zu den Calabim gehen. Es gibt kein besseres Versteck als einen Ort, den die sogenannten Rechtschaffenen meiden. Unter den gefürchteten Calabim kann ich ohne die Last der Gesetze, die mich bis jetzt gebunden haben, meinen Weg gehen.
TEXT.Italian: I will go to the Calabim. Better to hide where the so-called righteous fear to tread. Among the feared Calabim I can make my way less encumbered by the laws that have bound me to now.
TEXT.Spanish: I will go to the Calabim. Better to hide where the so-called righteous fear to tread. Among the feared Calabim I can make my way less encumbered by the laws that have bound me to now.

TEXT.English: I will go to the Malakim. I cannot turn my back on my beliefs, even if the land that I served has wronged me. Among the honest Malakim perhaps I can find some solace.
TEXT.French: I will go to the Malakim. I cannot turn my back on my beliefs, even if the land that I served has wronged me. Among the honest Malakim perhaps I can find some solace.
TEXT.German: Ich werde zu den Malakim gehen. Ich kann meinem Glauben nicht den Rücken kehren, selbst wenn das Land, dem ich gedient habe, mir Unrecht getan hat. Vielleicht finde ich unter den ehrlichen Malakim etwas Trost.
TEXT.Italian: I will go to the Malakim. I cannot turn my back on my beliefs, even if the land that I served has wronged me. Among the honest Malakim perhaps I can find some solace.
TEXT.Spanish: I will go to the Malakim. I cannot turn my back on my beliefs, even if the land that I served has wronged me. Among the honest Malakim perhaps I can find some solace.

TEXT.English: "The priests were wrong," Rosier argued. "I used the forbidden power and am neither tainted nor possessed. I am as much my own man as I ever was, if not more."
TEXT.French: "The priests were wrong," Rosier argued. "I used the forbidden power and am neither tainted nor possessed. I am as much my own man as I ever was, if not more."
TEXT.German: "Die Priester hatten Unrecht", folgerte Rosier. "Ich habe die verbotene Macht benutzt und bin weder verdorben noch besessen. Ich bin immer noch genau wie zuvor Herr meiner selbst, wenn nicht gar mehr."
TEXT.Italian: "The priests were wrong," Rosier argued. "I used the forbidden power and am neither tainted nor possessed. I am as much my own man as I ever was, if not more."
TEXT.Spanish: "The priests were wrong," Rosier argued. "I used the forbidden power and am neither tainted nor possessed. I am as much my own man as I ever was, if not more."

TEXT.English: Rosier, you have broken your vows, submit to the confessor and face trial.
TEXT.French: Rosier, you have broken your vows, submit to the confessor and face trial.
TEXT.German: Rosier, Ihr habt Euer Gelübde gebrochen. Unterwerft Euch dem Bekenner und stellt Euch dem Gericht.
TEXT.Italian: Rosier, you have broken your vows, submit to the confessor and face trial.
TEXT.Spanish: Rosier, you have broken your vows, submit to the confessor and face trial.

TEXT.English: Rosier rides off before you can stop him, he curses you as yet another puppet who has confused courage with obedience.
TEXT.French: Rosier rides off before you can stop him, he curses you as yet another puppet who has confused courage with obedience.
TEXT.German: Rosier reitet weg, bevor Ihr ihn aufhalten könnt. Er verflucht Euch als eine weitere Marionette, die Tapferkeit mit Gehorsam verwechselt.
TEXT.Italian: Rosier rides off before you can stop him, he curses you as yet another puppet who has confused courage with obedience.
TEXT.Spanish: Rosier rides off before you can stop him, he curses you as yet another puppet who has confused courage with obedience.

TEXT.English: I see no evil here, but you have transgressed the word of a Confessor. You will not be welcome here and I cannot take you in.
TEXT.French: I see no evil here, but you have transgressed the word of a Confessor. You will not be welcome here and I cannot take you in.
TEXT.German: Ich merke nichts Böses an Euch, aber Ihr habt Euch gegen das Wort eines Bekenners versündigt. Ihr seid hier nicht willkommen und ich kann Euch nicht aufnehmen.
TEXT.Italian: I see no evil here, but you have transgressed the word of a Confessor. You will not be welcome here and I cannot take you in.
TEXT.Spanish: I see no evil here, but you have transgressed the word of a Confessor. You will not be welcome here and I cannot take you in.

TEXT.English: Rosier clasps your hand. "Perhaps there is some hope for the Order," he says before mounting his horse and fleeing the Bannor lands.
TEXT.French: Rosier clasps your hand. "Perhaps there is some hope for the Order," he says before mounting his horse and fleeing the Bannor lands.
TEXT.German: Rosier ergreift Eure Hand. "Vielleicht gibt es noch etwas Hoffung für die Weisung", sagt er, bevor er auf sein Pferd steigt und aus dem Land der Bannor flieht.
TEXT.Italian: Rosier clasps your hand. "Perhaps there is some hope for the Order," he says before mounting his horse and fleeing the Bannor lands.
TEXT.Spanish: Rosier clasps your hand. "Perhaps there is some hope for the Order," he says before mounting his horse and fleeing the Bannor lands.

TEXT.English: If you wish to pass this gate of mine[NEWLINE]You must correctly solve my rhyme[NEWLINE]The Harpy, winged, watches coldly.[NEWLINE]A Satyr, piping, prances boldly.[NEWLINE]A Naga guarding, ever more.[NEWLINE]A Werewolf carved as from the floor.[NEWLINE]The Golem will round out the five.[NEWLINE]Choose the right one to stay alive![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Every monster likes to eat,[NEWLINE]Which finds Humans a tasty treat?[NEWLINE]Each one dwells in just one place,[NEWLINE]A single drink is for each race,[NEWLINE]All have colors, one apiece,[NEWLINE]The key is which on Humans feasts...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It's tough to know, without a clue,[NEWLINE]I will give, more than a few,[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One half a goat, lives in a tree,[NEWLINE]The serpentine, on Half-Elves feeds,[NEWLINE]The hairy one fills up on grog,[NEWLINE]Left of the dungeon are cliffs of fog,[NEWLINE]Cliff dwellers all drink ale, they say,[NEWLINE]He who eats Gnomes is fond of gray,[NEWLINE]Deep in the cave, one favors red,[NEWLINE]In center is the wino's bed,[NEWLINE]The feathered femme lives in the first,[NEWLINE]The friend of brown, for beer will thirst,[NEWLINE]The beast who prefers all things blacker,[NEWLINE]Resides next to the Dwarven snacker,[NEWLINE]Tis beside the one in red,[NEWLINE]Resides an Elven eater's stead,[NEWLINE]Next to the pit, the flyer dwells,[NEWLINE]The construct thinks that green is swell,[NEWLINE]A neighbor of the black of heart,[NEWLINE]Feels drinking water is an art.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]No more clues to help your plight,[NEWLINE]The answer given when it's right.[NEWLINE]Though when it's known, they'll be no doubt.[NEWLINE]So please don't plead, don't beg, don't pout.[NEWLINE]Divine the answer, though it's cruel,[NEWLINE]Who eats Humans as a rule?

TEXT.English: Naga?

TEXT.English: Satyr?
TEXT.French: Satyr?
TEXT.German: Satyr?
TEXT.Italian: Satyr?
TEXT.Spanish: Satyr?

TEXT.English: Werewolf?
TEXT.French: Werewolf?
TEXT.German: Werwolf?
TEXT.Italian: Werewolf?
TEXT.Spanish: Werewolf?

TEXT.English: The wall to the south has deep grooves around the edges, it looks to be a hidden door. Do you want to open up?
TEXT.French: The wall to the south has deep grooves around the edges, it looks to be a hidden door. Do you want to open up?
TEXT.German: Die Mauer im Süden hat tiefe Riefen an den Rändern. Es sieht aus wie eine Geheimtür. Wollt Ihr sie öffnen?
TEXT.Italian: The wall to the south has deep grooves around the edges, it looks to be a hidden door. Do you want to open up?
TEXT.Spanish: The wall to the south has deep grooves around the edges, it looks to be a hidden door. Do you want to open up?

TEXT.English: No, leave it be.
TEXT.French: No, leave it be.
TEXT.German: Nein, lasst sie, wie sie ist.
TEXT.Italian: No, leave it be.
TEXT.Spanish: No, leave it be.

TEXT.English: Yes, let's see what lies beyond.
TEXT.French: Yes, let's see what lies beyond.
TEXT.German: Ja, lasst uns sehen, was dahinter liegt.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, let's see what lies beyond.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, let's see what lies beyond.

TEXT.English: An emissary for Judecca requests audience with you. He offers peace if you only declare war against the %s1_player.
TEXT.French: An emissary for Judecca requests audience with you. He offers peace if you only declare war against the %s1_player.
TEXT.German: Ein Abgesandter von Judecca bittet um eine Audienz bei Euch. Er bietet Frieden, falls Ihr %s1_player den Krieg erklärt.
TEXT.Italian: An emissary for Judecca requests audience with you. He offers peace if you only declare war against the %s1_player.
TEXT.Spanish: An emissary for Judecca requests audience with you. He offers peace if you only declare war against the %s1_player.

TEXT.English: Lethe haunts your dreams. She claims that your %s3_unit seeks eternal rest but resists due to loyalty to you. If you would allow that unit to sacrifice itself Lethe would show her favor by making peace between your nations.
TEXT.French: Lethe haunts your dreams. She claims that your %s3_unit seeks eternal rest but resists due to loyalty to you. If you would allow that unit to sacrifice itself Lethe would show her favor by making peace between your nations.
TEXT.German: Lethe verfolgt Euch in Euren Träumen. Sie behauptet, [MUM3:Euer:Eure:Euer:Eure:Eure:Eure] %s3:1_unit sucht die ewige Ruhe, sträubt sich aber dagegen auf Grund der Treue Euch gegenüber. Falls Ihr der Einheit erlauben würdet, sich selbst zu opfern, würde Lethe Euch ihre Gunst erweisen, indem sie Frieden zwischen euren Reichen schlösse.
TEXT.Italian: Lethe haunts your dreams. She claims that your %s3_unit seeks eternal rest but resists due to loyalty to you. If you would allow that unit to sacrifice itself Lethe would show her favor by making peace between your nations.
TEXT.Spanish: Lethe haunts your dreams. She claims that your %s3_unit seeks eternal rest but resists due to loyalty to you. If you would allow that unit to sacrifice itself Lethe would show her favor by making peace between your nations.

TEXT.English: An apparition appears in your throne room, it is the glorious Meresin. He smiles down at you and, claiming extreme benevolence, offers peace between his armies and your own. The only price he asks is the slightest act of supplication, that you would kiss his feet.
TEXT.French: An apparition appears in your throne room, it is the glorious Meresin. He smiles down at you and, claiming extreme benevolence, offers peace between his armies and your own. The only price he asks is the slightest act of supplication, that you would kiss his feet.
TEXT.German: Ein Geist erscheint in Eurem Thronsaal, es ist der ruhmreiche Meresin. Er lächelt auf Euch herunter und bietet, sich äußerste Güte anmaßenend, Frieden zwischen seinen und Euren Armeen an. Der einzige Preis, den er dafür verlangt, ist die geringste Geste des Demuts, nämlich dass Ihr ihm die Füße küsst.
TEXT.Italian: An apparition appears in your throne room, it is the glorious Meresin. He smiles down at you and, claiming extreme benevolence, offers peace between his armies and your own. The only price he asks is the slightest act of supplication, that you would kiss his feet.
TEXT.Spanish: An apparition appears in your throne room, it is the glorious Meresin. He smiles down at you and, claiming extreme benevolence, offers peace between his armies and your own. The only price he asks is the slightest act of supplication, that you would kiss his feet.

TEXT.English: I came to purge this land of devils, not make deals with them.
TEXT.French: I came to purge this land of devils, not make deals with them.
TEXT.German: Ich bin gekommen, um dieses Land von den Teufeln zu säubern und nicht um mit ihnen Geschäfte zu machen.
TEXT.Italian: I came to purge this land of devils, not make deals with them.
TEXT.Spanish: I came to purge this land of devils, not make deals with them.

TEXT.English: Lord Ouzza praises your strength. He offers peace between his army and our own if we are willing to celebrate that peace by sacrificing some of the citizens of each of our cities to his glory.
TEXT.French: Lord Ouzza praises your strength. He offers peace between his army and our own if we are willing to celebrate that peace by sacrificing some of the citizens of each of our cities to his glory.
TEXT.German: Fürst Ouzza preist Eure Stärke. Er bietet Frieden zwischen seiner und unserer Armee an, falls wir bereit wären, diesen Friedensschluss zu feiern, indem wir einige Bürger von jeder unserer Städte seiner Herrlichkeit opfern.
TEXT.Italian: Lord Ouzza praises your strength. He offers peace between his army and our own if we are willing to celebrate that peace by sacrificing some of the citizens of each of our cities to his glory.
TEXT.Spanish: Lord Ouzza praises your strength. He offers peace between his army and our own if we are willing to celebrate that peace by sacrificing some of the citizens of each of our cities to his glory.

TEXT.English: The shadow of Duke Sallos himself falls over your bed. He is dark, powerful and beautiful. He offers you peace in exchange for that which he desires most, a night of carnal pleasure between the two of you.
TEXT.French: The shadow of Duke Sallos himself falls over your bed. He is dark, powerful and beautiful. He offers you peace in exchange for that which he desires most, a night of carnal pleasure between the two of you.
TEXT.German: Der Schatten von Herzog Sallos selbst fällt auf Euer Bett. Er ist dunkel, mächtig und schön zugleich. Er bietet Euch Frieden im Tausch für das, was er dringlichsten begehrt, eine Nacht voll fleischlichem Vergnügen zwischen euch beiden.
TEXT.Italian: The shadow of Duke Sallos himself falls over your bed. He is dark, powerful and beautiful. He offers you peace in exchange for that which he desires most, a night of carnal pleasure between the two of you.
TEXT.Spanish: The shadow of Duke Sallos himself falls over your bed. He is dark, powerful and beautiful. He offers you peace in exchange for that which he desires most, a night of carnal pleasure between the two of you.

TEXT.English: You wake up to find a succubus in the service of Duke Sallos floating above your bed. She is dark and beautiful. She whispers to you, offering peace with her lord if you are willing to consummate the agreement with the most intimate of acts.
TEXT.French: You wake up to find a succubus in the service of Duke Sallos floating above your bed. She is dark and beautiful. She whispers to you, offering peace with her lord if you are willing to consummate the agreement with the most intimate of acts.
TEXT.German: Ihr erwacht und werdet eines Sukkubus in Diensten von Herzog Sallos gewahr, der über Eurem Bett schwebt. Sie ist dunkel und schön zugleich. Sie flüstert mit Euch und bietet Frieden mit ihrem Herren an, falls Ihr bereit wärt, das Abkommen mit dem intimsten aller Akte zu besiegeln.
TEXT.Italian: You wake up to find a succubus in the service of Duke Sallos floating above your bed. She is dark and beautiful. She whispers to you, offering peace with her lord if you are willing to consummate the agreement with the most intimate of acts.
TEXT.Spanish: You wake up to find a succubus in the service of Duke Sallos floating above your bed. She is dark and beautiful. She whispers to you, offering peace with her lord if you are willing to consummate the agreement with the most intimate of acts.

TEXT.English: A beetle shaped demon approaches under the banner of Statius. He offers peace with his lord in exchange for the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: A beetle shaped demon approaches under the banner of Statius. He offers peace with his lord in exchange for the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Ein Dämon in der Form eines Käfers nähert sich unter dem Banner von Statius. Er bietet Frieden mit seinem Herren im Tausch für die Stadt %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: A beetle shaped demon approaches under the banner of Statius. He offers peace with his lord in exchange for the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A beetle shaped demon approaches under the banner of Statius. He offers peace with his lord in exchange for the city of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: I will pay your price, we will have peace. At least for a time.
TEXT.French: I will pay your price, we will have peace. At least for a time.
TEXT.German: Ich werde Euren Preis bezahlen. Wir werden Frieden haben, zumindest für eine gewisse Zeit.
TEXT.Italian: I will pay your price, we will have peace. At least for a time.
TEXT.Spanish: I will pay your price, we will have peace. At least for a time.

TEXT.English: Amelanchier is defeated and your troops capture him fleeing the smoking remains of his capital. Your huntresses bind him and bring him to your camp. Amelanchier refuses to speak or acknowledge the power of the winter court. Distant howls interrupt your decision, and it is followed by a pack of wolves, half-wolves and beastmen entering your camp. Baron Duin Halfmorn leads them, and he makes a single request.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I offer my alliance if you give me Amelanchier, I wish to add him to my pack."
TEXT.French: Amelanchier is defeated and your troops capture him fleeing the smoking remains of his capital. Your huntresses bind him and bring him to your camp. Amelanchier refuses to speak or acknowledge the power of the winter court. Distant howls interrupt your decision, and it is followed by a pack of wolves, half-wolves and beastmen entering your camp. Baron Duin Halfmorn leads them, and he makes a single request.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I offer my alliance if you give me Amelanchier, I wish to add him to my pack."
TEXT.German: Amelanchier ist besiegt und Eure Truppen nehmen ihn gefangen, als er aus den rauchenden Überresten seiner Hauptstadt fliehen will. Eure Jägerinnen fesseln ihn und bringen ihn in Euer Lager. Amelanchier weigert sich zu sprechen oder die Macht des Winterhofes anzuerkennen. Eure Entscheidung über ihn wird von einem fernen Heulen gestört, dem bald darauf ein Rudel aus Wölfen, Halb-Wölfen und Stammeskriegern folgt, die Euer Lager betreten. Baron Duin Halfmorn führt sie an und stellt eine einzige Forderung.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich biete Euch meine Gefolgschaft an, wenn Ihr mir Amelanchier überlasst. Ich möchte ihn meinem Rudel hinzufügen."
TEXT.Italian: Amelanchier is defeated and your troops capture him fleeing the smoking remains of his capital. Your huntresses bind him and bring him to your camp. Amelanchier refuses to speak or acknowledge the power of the winter court. Distant howls interrupt your decision, and it is followed by a pack of wolves, half-wolves and beastmen entering your camp. Baron Duin Halfmorn leads them, and he makes a single request.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I offer my alliance if you give me Amelanchier, I wish to add him to my pack."
TEXT.Spanish: Amelanchier is defeated and your troops capture him fleeing the smoking remains of his capital. Your huntresses bind him and bring him to your camp. Amelanchier refuses to speak or acknowledge the power of the winter court. Distant howls interrupt your decision, and it is followed by a pack of wolves, half-wolves and beastmen entering your camp. Baron Duin Halfmorn leads them, and he makes a single request.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I offer my alliance if you give me Amelanchier, I wish to add him to my pack."

TEXT.English: No, have Amelanchier jailed. He deserves better than a military execution.
TEXT.French: No, have Amelanchier jailed. He deserves better than a military execution.
TEXT.German: Nein, lasst Amelanchier einsperren. Er verdient besseres als eine militärische Hinrichtung.
TEXT.Italian: No, have Amelanchier jailed. He deserves better than a military execution.
TEXT.Spanish: No, have Amelanchier jailed. He deserves better than a military execution.

TEXT.English: No, kill him. I'd rather have elven blood spilt on the grass than tainted by beasts.
TEXT.French: No, kill him. I'd rather have elven blood spilt on the grass than tainted by beasts.
TEXT.German: Nein, tötet ihn. Ich vergieße lieber Elfenblut auf dem Gras, als dass es von Bestien verdorben wird.
TEXT.Italian: No, kill him. I'd rather have elven blood spilt on the grass than tainted by beasts.
TEXT.Spanish: No, kill him. I'd rather have elven blood spilt on the grass than tainted by beasts.

TEXT.English: Do with him as you will. The wolves will make powerful allies.
TEXT.French: Do with him as you will. The wolves will make powerful allies.
TEXT.German: Tut mit ihm, was Ihr wollt. Die Wölfe werden mächtige Verbündete abgeben.
TEXT.Italian: Do with him as you will. The wolves will make powerful allies.
TEXT.Spanish: Do with him as you will. The wolves will make powerful allies.

TEXT.English: Rivanna is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Now she stands before you, bound and under close guard. But just as you are about to give your verdict the shadows seem to stretch and consume the chamber. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Rivanna, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."
TEXT.French: Rivanna is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Now she stands before you, bound and under close guard. But just as you are about to give your verdict the shadows seem to stretch and consume the chamber. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Rivanna, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."
TEXT.German: Rivanna ist besiegt und viele Eurer Jägerinnen werden beim Versuch getötet, sie gefangenzunehmen. Nun steht sie vor Euch, gefesselt und unter strenger Bewachung. Aber gerade als Ihr Euer Urteil sprechen wollt, scheinen sich die Schatten auszudehen und die Kammer zu verschlingen. Eine schöne Menschenfrau steht im Zentrum der Schatten, Alexis von den Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich bin gekommen, um um das Leben von Rivanna zu bitten. Sie wäre gut als dunkle Königin geeignet. Im Gegenzug kann ich die Gefolgschaft der Calabim anbieten."
TEXT.Italian: Rivanna is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Now she stands before you, bound and under close guard. But just as you are about to give your verdict the shadows seem to stretch and consume the chamber. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Rivanna, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."
TEXT.Spanish: Rivanna is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Now she stands before you, bound and under close guard. But just as you are about to give your verdict the shadows seem to stretch and consume the chamber. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Rivanna, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."

TEXT.English: No, she will have the compassion of the summer court. We will hold a trial for her crimes.
TEXT.French: No, she will have the compassion of the summer court. We will hold a trial for her crimes.
TEXT.German: Nein, sie kann sich der Barmherzigkeit des Sommerhofes erfreuen. Wir werden über ihre Verbrechen zu Gericht sitzen.
TEXT.Italian: No, she will have the compassion of the summer court. We will hold a trial for her crimes.
TEXT.Spanish: No, she will have the compassion of the summer court. We will hold a trial for her crimes.

TEXT.English: There is only one response to treason, kill her.
TEXT.French: There is only one response to treason, kill her.
TEXT.German: Auf Verrat gibt es nur eine Antwort: tötet sie.
TEXT.Italian: There is only one response to treason, kill her.
TEXT.Spanish: There is only one response to treason, kill her.

TEXT.English: The friendship of the Calabim is appreciated, Rivanna is yours.
TEXT.French: The friendship of the Calabim is appreciated, Rivanna is yours.
TEXT.German: Die Freundschaft mit den Calabim ist hoch geschätzt. Rivanna gehört Euch.
TEXT.Italian: The friendship of the Calabim is appreciated, Rivanna is yours.
TEXT.Spanish: The friendship of the Calabim is appreciated, Rivanna is yours.

TEXT.English: Thessa is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Some say an angel stood protectively over her, but if it is true that angel is gone now. Now Thessa stands before you, bound and under close guard. But just as you are about to give your verdict the shadows seem to stretch and consume the chamber. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Thessa, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."
TEXT.French: Thessa is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Some say an angel stood protectively over her, but if it is true that angel is gone now. Now Thessa stands before you, bound and under close guard. But just as you are about to give your verdict the shadows seem to stretch and consume the chamber. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Thessa, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."
TEXT.German: Thessa ist besiegt und viele Eurer Jägerinnen werden beim Versuch getötet, sie gefangenzunehmen. Manche sagen, dass ihr ein Engel beschützend zur Seite stand, aber falls das wahr gewesen ist, ist er jetzt verschwunden. Nun steht sie vor Euch, gefesselt und unter strenger Bewachung. Aber gerade als Ihr Euer Urteil sprechen wollt, scheinen sich die Schatten auszudehen und die Kammer zu verschlingen. Eine schöne Menschenfrau steht im Zentrum der Schatten, Alexis von den Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich bin gekommen, um um das Leben von Thessa zu bitten. Sie wäre gut als dunkle Königin geeignet. Im Gegenzug kann ich die Gefolgschaft der Calabim anbieten."

I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."
TEXT.Spanish: Thessa is defeated and many of your hunters are killed trying to capture her. Some say an angel stood protectively over her, but if it is true that angel is gone now. A beautiful human woman stands at the heart of the shadows, Alexis of the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have come to entreat for the life of Thessa, she would be more fitting as a dark queen. I can offer the loyalty of the Calabim in exchange."

TEXT.English: No, Thessa is deluded by the Summer queen but she will be imprisoned for her crimes.
TEXT.French: No, Thessa is deluded by the Summer queen but she will be imprisoned for her crimes.
TEXT.German: Nein, Thessa ist von der Sommerkönigin getäuscht worden, aber sie wird für ihre Verbrechen im Gefängnis büßen müssen.
TEXT.Italian: No, Thessa is deluded by the Summer queen but she will be imprisoned for her crimes.
TEXT.Spanish: No, Thessa is deluded by the Summer queen but she will be imprisoned for her crimes.

TEXT.English: Thessa has been apart from her husband for too long, allow them to remeet in the afterworld.
TEXT.French: Thessa has been apart from her husband for too long, allow them to remeet in the afterworld.
TEXT.German: Thessa ist viel zu lange von ihrem Ehemann getrennt gewesen. Erlaubt ihnen sich im Jenseits wiederzusehen.
TEXT.Italian: Thessa has been apart from her husband for too long, allow them to remeet in the afterworld.
TEXT.Spanish: Thessa has been apart from her husband for too long, allow them to remeet in the afterworld.

TEXT.English: Accept her with the regards of the winter queen. We look forward to improved relations with the Calabim.
TEXT.French: Accept her with the regards of the winter queen. We look forward to improved relations with the Calabim.
TEXT.German: Nehmt sie mit den besten Empfehlungen der Winterkönigin. Wir sehen den verbesserten Beziehungen mit den Calabim freudig entgegen.
TEXT.Italian: Accept her with the regards of the winter queen. We look forward to improved relations with the Calabim.
TEXT.Spanish: Accept her with the regards of the winter queen. We look forward to improved relations with the Calabim.

TEXT.English: Volanna is defeated and your troops capture her fleeing the smoking remains of her capital. Your huntresses bind her and bring her to your camp. Volanna refuses to speak or acknowledge the power of the winter court. Distant howls interrupt your decision, and it is followed by a pack of wolves, half-wolves and beastmen entering your camp. Baron Duin Halfmorn leads them, and he makes a single request.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I offer my alliance if you give me Volanna, I wish to add her to my pack."

TEXT.German: Nein, sie kann sich der Barmherzigkeit des Sommerhofes erfreuen. Wir werden über ihre Verbrechen zu Gericht sitzen.

TEXT.English: There is only one response to treason, kill her.
TEXT.French: There is only one response to treason, kill her.
TEXT.German: Auf Verrat gibt es nur eine Antwort: tötet sie.
TEXT.Italian: There is only one response to treason, kill her.
TEXT.Spanish: There is only one response to treason, kill her.

TEXT.English: We accept the brotherhood of the wolves, Volanna is yours to do with as you will.
TEXT.French: We accept the brotherhood of the wolves, Volanna is yours to do with as you will.
TEXT.German: Wir nehmen das Angebot der Wolfsbruderschaft an. Volanna gehört euch. Tut mit ihr, was ihr wollt.
TEXT.Italian: We accept the brotherhood of the wolves, Volanna is yours to do with as you will.
TEXT.Spanish: We accept the brotherhood of the wolves, Volanna is yours to do with as you will.

TEXT.English: One of your aides, a young elven hunter named Parith approaches you in private. With some moderate financing he offers to head out of the Umbrawood and seek a country that may be sympathetic to your cause. How do you respond?
TEXT.French: One of your aides, a young elven hunter named Parith approaches you in private. With some moderate financing he offers to head out of the Umbrawood and seek a country that may be sympathetic to your cause. How do you respond?
TEXT.German: Einer Eurer Berater, ein junger Elfen-Jäger namens Parith, führt ein vertrauliches Gespräch mit Euch. Er bietet Euch an, gegen eine bescheidene Vergütung den Umbrawald zu verlassen und ein Reich zu suchen, das Eurer Sache aufgeschlossen gegenübersteht. Wie lautet Eure Antwort?
TEXT.Italian: One of your aides, a young elven hunter named Parith approaches you in private. With some moderate financing he offers to head out of the Umbrawood and seek a country that may be sympathetic to your cause. How do you respond?
TEXT.Spanish: One of your aides, a young elven hunter named Parith approaches you in private. With some moderate financing he offers to head out of the Umbrawood and seek a country that may be sympathetic to your cause. How do you respond?

TEXT.English: No, we will win our own war.
TEXT.French: No, we will win our own war.
TEXT.German: Nein, wir werden unseren eigenen Krieg gewinnen.
TEXT.Italian: No, we will win our own war.
TEXT.Spanish: No, we will win our own war.

TEXT.English: Very well, take what you need and go quickly.
TEXT.French: Very well, take what you need and go quickly.
TEXT.German: Also gut, nehmt, was Ihr benötigt, und geht schnell.
TEXT.Italian: Very well, take what you need and go quickly.
TEXT.Spanish: Very well, take what you need and go quickly.

TEXT.English: Which civilization would you like to lead this city? This will control the type of units and buildings that can be produced here.
TEXT.French: Which civilization would you like to lead this city? This will control the type of units and buildings that can be produced here.
TEXT.German: Welche Zivilisation soll die Kontrolle über diese Stadt erhalten? Dies wird beeinflussen, welche Einheiten hier aufgestellt und welche Gebäude hier errichtet werden können.
TEXT.Italian: Which civilization would you like to lead this city? This will control the type of units and buildings that can be produced here.
TEXT.Spanish: Which civilization would you like to lead this city? This will control the type of units and buildings that can be produced here.

TEXT.English: I've been playing this clown's game for too long. Together you and I could overthrow him, take the boats you need and I will aid you in your war. It's better than playing puppets to a madman!
TEXT.French: I've been playing this clown's game for too long. Together you and I could overthrow him, take the boats you need and I will aid you in your war. It's better than playing puppets to a madman!
TEXT.German: Ich habe dieses Kaspertheater lange genug mitgespielt. Zusammen könnten wir ihn stürzen: nehmt die Schiffe, die Ihr benötigt, und ich werde Euch bei Eurem Krieg unterstützen. Das ist besser, als weiter die Marionette eines Wahnsinnigen zu spielen!

TEXT.English: I will join you, let us relieve the Momus of his throne.

TEXT.German: Ich werde mich Euch anschließen. Lasst uns den Momus um seinen Thron erleichtern.

TEXT.Spanish: I will join you, let us relieve the Momus of his throne.

TEXT.English: A deep blue demon with a goat's head and shattered bones approaches under the flag of diplomacy.[PARAGRAPH:1]"You lead your men well, and we bear no love for Tebryn. We offer free passage through our lands, if you will join us in sacking Bourne the Gleaming.
TEXT.French: A deep blue demon with a goat's head and shattered bones approaches under the flag of diplomacy.[PARAGRAPH:1]"You lead your men well, and we bear no love for Tebryn. We offer free passage through our lands, if you will join us in sacking Bourne the Gleaming.
TEXT.German: Ein tiefblauer Dämon mit dem Kopf einer Ziege und zerschlagenen Knochen nähert sich mit einer Parlamentärsflagge.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ihr führt Eure Männer gut und wir tragen keine Liebe für Tebryn in uns. Wir bieten freie Passage durch unsere Lande, falls Ihr uns helft, Bourne die Strahlende zu plündern.

TEXT.English: The seas belong to the Lanun, and you are in no position to negotiate the terms of its travel. Tell your master we are done playing with his armies and we mean to end this game.
TEXT.French: The seas belong to the Lanun, and you are in no position to negotiate the terms of its travel. Tell your master we are done playing with his armies and we mean to end this game.
TEXT.German: Die Meere gehören den Lanun und Ihr seid nicht in der Position, über die Bedingungen ihrer Durchquerung zu verhandeln. Sagt Eurem Herren, dass wir damit fertig wären, mit seinen Armeen zu spielen, und wir nun vorhaben, dieses Spiel zu beenden.

TEXT.English: I tire of the Empyrean and prefer the company of the night. Very well, we will join you against the Mercurians.

TEXT.German: Ich bin des Empyrions müde und bevorzuge die Gesellschaft der Nacht. Also gut, wir werden Euch gegen die Mercurianer unterstützen.

TEXT.English: Description: Decius takes his battle to the Sidar.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Wages of Sin scenario.

TEXT.English: After the third group of hunters went missing, Decius started to get upset. The trip south from the lands that he had conquered around Tempus Mor was rife with danger, as mountain passes ended in steep drops as often as not, and even the gentle slopes led down into mist-filled valleys with treacherous bogs and swamplands. They were easy prey at night; even the Nightwatch would often be found slain in the morning. He began to wish that his whole group had taken the sea route again, but he hadn't wanted to risk Overcouncil or Sidar forces coming in from the north and pinching them against the main Sidar army.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Even the Svartalfar hunters who guided them, experts at avoiding detection, would find some among their numbers poached.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then one morning they awoke to find a whole company of bloodpets dead. Decius ground his teeth as the bit of sun that came through the thick clouds illuminated the grisly scene.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Commander, may we speak?" The voice came from above as the speaker slowly descended. A succubus, sent with word of Os-Gabella's offer and to assist Decius. It was less an offer and more a plea; were he to return with the blade that slew Ethne of the Elohim, he could name his price from the old sorceress. It was too tempting of an offer for him to pass up, not to mention the value he would get from using these Sidar as his personal spies should he subdue them. But just finding them was proving a most difficult quest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, what is it?" Decius averted his eyes from her shapely, and nude, form, not out of modesty but because he didn't want to be reminded at the moment of another woman whose company he had recently kept, the druid Talia Gosam.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You are a wise commander, but you are still blind to some of the options that are open to you. Why do you grieve the loss of these troops?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm not in the mood for games, creature. What is your suggestion?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"They did not serve you willingly in life; why let them take to death against your wishes? We can animate these bodies, and send them ahead. Let the Sidar ghosts strike with their poisoned blades against hearts no longer beating."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, we'll make them strike twice for every kill."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Furthermore, their assassins have been aiming for our scouts and workers, or other weaker troops. Let us petition Esus to deceive their eyes. For Agares to grant us allies more at home in the darkness than our foes are. To Aeron, for strength to fight frenzied even when poisoned and dying. And most importantly, to Ceridwen, for the secret knowledge the great seer holds."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I don't like seeking the help of gods. They usually take more than they give."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Our gods will not collect on their debt for some time Decius. Their goals align with yours, and they do not seek to pull your strings, as you already follow their path. Their price is cheaper than losing your head to an assassin's blade."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius stared at the demon for a moment. "Very well. What is needed?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The ritual was prepared. Decius's blood was spilled into the fires, and he recited the prayers. In the dancing flames, the valley was illuminated, showing the path to take to the enemy's gates."

TEXT.English: The Elohim sent a guide to lead the Malakim to the Astur wastes, and the Ljosalfar lent a skilled elven tracker. The assassin Decius captured was bound and marched at the head of the column.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Still the winding paths claimed many as they traveled in pursuit of the hidden civilization of the Sidar. Mountain passes dropped into valleys cloaked in fog, filled with swamps and ruins. Even when not on the move, men disappeared at night, until a full score of Lightbringers were posted guard each sundown. Even so, the Sidar captive was taken back by his allies one night, out from under the Malakim guards. The next day Decius marched the Malakim forces harder, keeping scouting parties roving constantly around the main force but never out of sight of one another. And still nearly a third of his forces were cut off navigating a swampy valley in the dense fog, lost from the rest of the company. When Decius found out, he ordered his army to stop and set up camp at the nearest hilltop, deciding that it was time to try something new.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Greetings, lord," the Vicar said as Decius entered the tent used as temple. "Have you orders?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. I would like to pray." The Vicar nodded, lighting incense and beginning the recitation of Lugus's noontime prayer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I meant alone." Decius waited while the Vicar left. Decius stood, then knelt, then finally sat near the altar, arms crossed and staring into the brazier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This was a holy place, but Decius felt no special kinship to Lugus, despite his friend's devotion. Junil and justice he had been taught to revere, but Decius had betrayed Junil's chosen people. Who should he turn to? Sirona, Ethne's patron? Sucellus, God of Life? Or... who? His theological knowledge didn't extend very deep, and shortly gave up trying to decide the best recipient of his pleas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Oh gods who love justice and oppose the spreading darkness, hear me. I have failed you in the past, sometimes greatly. I have been rash and selfish, and am not a disciple of your ways. But you have failed me as well, or least your followers and laws have. Do not let my people die in this valley of death. A good woman's soul is doomed if we fail. And if the Calabim and their allies manage to subdue these Sidar ghosts, they stand to turn the tide of the war we've almost won. Surely the end of the world should draw your attention? Surely opposing this grave evil merits your favor? I am an imperfect champion, but do not let these good people suffer for my impurity. Show me the way, and I yield my will to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius waited briefly for a sign. Then sighed and left the tent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The fog had lifted from the valley, and the clouds above had parted. The way was made clear. Hunters' hawks took flight. Soon they learned that they were not far from the enemy's borders, and the treacherous passage would be safer in this clear day.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Should we continue the march?" asked one of his commanders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Not yet. Set up a permanent encampment here. This hill is the place of our deliverance, from where we will prepare to take the Sidar capital and their warriors as our vassals."

TEXT.Italian: The Elohim sent a guide to lead the Malakim to the Astur wastes, and the Ljosalfar lent a skilled elven tracker. The assassin Decius captured was bound and marched at the head of the column.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Still the winding paths claimed many as they traveled in pursuit of the hidden civilization of the Sidar. Mountain passes dropped into valleys cloaked in fog, filled with swamps and ruins. Even when not on the move, men disappeared at night, until a full score of Lightbringers were posted guard each sundown. Even so, the Sidar captive was taken back by his allies one night, out from under the Malakim guards. The next day Decius marched the Malakim forces harder, keeping scouting parties roving constantly around the main force but never out of sight of one another. And still nearly a third of his forces were cut off navigating a swampy valley in the dense fog, lost from the rest of the company. When Decius found out, he ordered his army to stop and set up camp at the nearest hilltop, deciding that it was time to try something new.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Greetings, lord," the Vicar said as Decius entered the tent used as temple. "Have you orders?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. I would like to pray." The Vicar nodded, lighting incense and beginning the recitation of Lugus's noontime prayer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I meant alone." Decius waited while the Vicar left. Decius stood, then knelt, then finally sat near the altar, arms crossed and staring into the brazier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This was a holy place, but Decius felt no special kinship to Lugus, despite his friend's devotion. Junil and justice he had been taught to revere, but Decius had betrayed Junil's chosen people. Who should he turn to? Sirona, Ethne's patron? Sucellus, God of Life? Or... who? His theological knowledge didn't extend very deep, and shortly gave up trying to decide the best recipient of his pleas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Oh gods who love justice and oppose the spreading darkness, hear me. I have failed you in the past, sometimes greatly. I have been rash and selfish, and am not a disciple of your ways. But you have failed me as well, or least your followers and laws have. Do not let my people die in this valley of death. A good woman's soul is doomed if we fail. And if the Calabim and their allies manage to subdue these Sidar ghosts, they stand to turn the tide of the war we've almost won. Surely the end of the world should draw your attention? Surely opposing this grave evil merits your favor? I am an imperfect champion, but do not let these good people suffer for my impurity. Show me the way, and I yield my will to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius waited briefly for a sign. Then sighed and left the tent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The fog had lifted from the valley, and the clouds above had parted. The way was made clear. Hunters' hawks took flight. Soon they learned that they were not far from the enemy's borders, and the treacherous passage would be safer in this clear day.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Should we continue the march?" asked one of his commanders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Not yet. Set up a permanent encampment here. This hill is the place of our deliverance, from where we will prepare to take the Sidar capital and their warriors as our vassals."

TEXT.English: "This is but a room," the voice said, "And your entrance here means nothing. We will leave this place and find another."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This isn't the first of your cities that have been conquered, shade. I will not give up until you yield. The world is not as big as it once was, when it emerged from winter wild and open. Places to hide are running out."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon appeared behind him. "What do you want, Decius? A Sidar assassin to strike against your father in Torrolerial? He has his hands full with the Doviello invasion, I think. We could slay Varn Gosam in his sleep, if you still despise him, or free you from your obligations to Flauros while he feeds."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You know so much about me? I think it is time for you to start answering my questions."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Giving answers isn't what we do. We watch and plan and wait and, if absolutely necessary, we act, without the world knowing we were here. To preserve the Sidar and our seclusion." Sandalphon faded from view again. Decius turned to Losha Valus, and gestured to the slain shades scattered around the Sidar throne room. Losha and the other vampires accompanying Decius raised them as skeletons.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Face me Sandalphon, or every Sidar man, woman, and child we have killed or will ever find will be raised as a skeleton and sent to hunt you down. Will you enjoy your long life being forever invisible?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No!" Sandalphon's rage was the first emotion he had shown. "Leave them be. You have no right to abuse the dead. These bodies are all that remains in this world of our friends, and you have no right to enslave them. I will yield to you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius nodded, and Losha released the bodies of the slain shades. "I want to know why you attacked me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Calabim are an intriguing people, not unlike us until recently. You have led them to be more aggressive with your leadership, since you did not face the hardship that they saw during the Age of Winter. After your success in the war of Tempus Mor, we predicted a resurgent Calabim ruling over the entire world, and feasting on the Sidar. The risk of this outweighed the risk of revealing ourselves, and so we activated our assassins in the area. Unfortunately, only Rathus accomplished his goal."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He was the one who struck at the Elohim, then? I have a friend who badly wants his sword." Decius pulled out the Nether Blade that they had taken from Rathus's corpse and examined it. Green runes pulsed along the light ebon blade. "What makes this sword special?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Nether Blade is an artifact from the underworld. Its power draws any it slays into Arawns lands and anchors them in his vault."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Hmm. I think this might be better than whatever Os-Gabella could offer me. It isn't enough to compensate us for all that we have lost since your attack on us... but I dare not invite you into our midst; it would only be inviting my death. We will take what we need of your supplies and leave you here in peace, to live your long, quiet, isolated lives. But the secrets of the Sidar will be spread far and wide among the Calabim. If you strike at us again, everything that you have built will be destroyed and your people will be put to death and then enslaved until the end of time."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is as generous as we can expect from you, I am well aware," Sandalphon replied. Suddenly from behind him another ghost appeared, drawing their attention. "Belthus, welcome back," Sandalphon said. "How went your mission?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric Ulvin's war will not be stopped so easy. I could not get near him. He radiates with the power of Winter, a power not seen on Erebus for generations, and his army grows more numerous. It seems the endless winter is more likely than we thought."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who is this Auric Ulvin?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Belthus, this is Decius of the Calabim. We were just discussing the future sovereignty of the Sidar in light of the Calabim's brutal conquest. Decius, we have our eye on more than just the nations nearest us. In the distant Aquillo Tundra occur events that could trouble us even here. Auric is a magical prodigy, and this power made him a suitable vessel for the machinations of the power of winter. Mulcarn was killed by the Godslayer, leaving his sphere without a suitable ruler. Auric has drawn together the tools of that god, and is preparing to become its avatar. Belthus was sent to stop him, but we acted too late. If the armies gathering against him do not stop him, he will return all Erebus to an Age of Winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked at the sword he held in his hands for a moment, then he sheathed it. "What if a god was not slain with the Godslayer, but trapped by the Nether Blade?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon shrugged. "We have no experience with that."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric poses a grave threat. We will go to support those who stand against him, and if the Nether Blade staves off this threat for good, perhaps it can rid me of my troublesome allies as well."

Mulcarn was killed by the Godslayer, leaving his sphere without a suitable ruler. Auric has drawn together the tools of that god, and is preparing to become its avatar. Belthus was sent to stop him, but we acted too late. If the armies gathering against him do not stop him, he will return all Erebus to an Age of Winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked at the sword he held in his hands for a moment, then he sheathed it. "What if a god was not slain with the Godslayer, but trapped by the Nether Blade?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon shrugged. "We have no experience with that."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric poses a grave threat. We will go to support those who stand against him, and if the Nether Blade staves off this threat for good, perhaps it can rid me of my troublesome allies as well."

TEXT.English: "This is but a room," the voice said, "And your entrance here means nothing. We will leave this place and find another."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This isn't the first of your cities that have been conquered, shade. I will not give up until you yield. The world is not as big as it once was, when it emerged from winter wild and open. Places to hide are running out."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon appeared behind him. "What do you want, Decius? A Sidar assassin to strike against your father in Torrolerial? He has his hands full with the Doviello invasion, I think. Would you prefer we poison the Calabim lords? We prefer not to draw the attention of other immortals to ourselves; we are still new at this and they may know more than us."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You know so much about me, do you? I think it is time for you to start answering my questions."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Giving answers isn't what we do. We watch and plan and wait and, if absolutely necessary, we act, without the world knowing we were here. To preserve the Sidar and our seclusion." Sandalphon faded from view again. Decius turned to Vaughn, and the Paladin brought forth a relic of Lugus, flooding the room with light, revealing Sandalphon sitting calmly on his throne. "You seem to have me at a disadvantage. What are your terms?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I want to know why you attacked Ethne and me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You were both instrumental in leading the war in Tempus Mor, dangerously close to this secluded valley. And you were winning. Based on our observations of your actions in the desert of Myrh, we calculated that an empowered Overcouncil flush with victory would try to expand its position here, attempting to bring us under their 'enlightened' sovereignty. The risk of inaction seemed greater than the risk of action, so we activated our assassins in the region, to attempt to bring a stalemate to the battle and dissuade you from going further. Unfortunately, our plans failed, and here you are."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is what you do? You decide who lives and dies based on what you think that they will do?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon sneered at Decius, the first hint of emotion that he displayed. "You are so much better? You are a ruler-you decide who lives and dies among the untold number that dwell within your borders. Among your soldiers you execute those who betray or desert you, and unleash them on those who would stand against you. You exercise the power of the judge over many, yet you take offense at we who dare to judge only a few, only the kings or priests or generals?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have no authority over me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We have the same authority over you that you have over your citizens-we have the power to act on our judgments."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius sighed. "I had come hoping to take you as my vassal, to use you against my enemies. I see now that that would be a foolish plan, only inviting my death or that of my heir. Here is what I propose instead. Give me an advisor. We will leave you to yourselves, to live your long, quiet, isolated lives, but send one of your number to sit in our councils, not as a member but to warn us before you strike. Why should my death be your first course of action?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon considered him. "This is acceptable. Provided that you personally tell no one of our existence. You can work through your council to see that our few interests are maintained, and we shall likewise leave the world alone for as long as we think wise."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There is one other condition. I want the soul of Ethne freed. She was slain and cannot be resurrected."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Elohim woman... Rathus took the Nether Blade when he attacked her, because she knows the secrets of the Mercurian Gate, passed down through the regents of the Elohim."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There is no point it slaying her for that now; the secret has been used, and spread throughout the Empyrean to Bourne the Gleaming. Release her spirit."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Nether Blade is an artifact from the underworld. It will draw the soul of anyone it slays into Arawns realm and anchors them there. Destroying it should free those whose souls belong elsewhere. Free them to serve their true lord, be it in their vault or recalled to Erebus."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Then I shall do so, and free Ethne to return to her people." Decius pulled out the blade that they had taken from Rathus's corpse and studied it for a moment. Green runes pulsed along the light ebon blade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Behind Sandalphon another Ghost appeared suddenly, drawing their attention. "Belthus, welcome back," Sandalphon said. "How went your mission?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric Ulvin's war will not be stopped so easy. I could not get near him. He radiates with the power of Winter, a power not seen on Erebus for generations, and his army grows more numerous. It seems the endless winter is more likely than we thought."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric Ulvin? I know that name..." said Decius.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who is this?" asked Belthus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Decius leads the Malakim army. They have discovered us, but we have come to an understanding."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Varn Gosam met Auric Ulvin. Varn gave up his vaunted position among a secluded elven tribe to free him, though it would have cost them both their lives had Auric's great power not manifested."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric is a magical prodigy, and this power made him a suitable vessel for the machinations of the power of winter. Mulcarn was killed by the Godslayer, leaving his sphere without a suitable ruler. Auric has drawn together the tools of that god, and is preparing to become its avatar. Belthus was sent to stop him, but we acted too late. If the armies gathering against him do not stop him, he will return all Erebus to an Age of Winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked at the sword he held in his hands for a moment, then he sheathed it. "What if a god was not slain with the Godslayer, but trapped by the Nether Blade?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon shrugged. "We have no experience with that. I thought you intended to free your friend?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric poses a grave threat. We will go to support those who stand against him, and if the Nether Blade staves off this threat for good... I can only hope that Ethne forgives me."

If the armies gathering against him do not stop him, he will return all Erebus to an Age of Winter."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked at the sword he held in his hands for a moment, then he sheathed it. "What if a god was not slain with the Godslayer, but trapped by the Nether Blade?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sandalphon shrugged. "We have no experience with that. I thought you intended to free your friend?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Auric poses a grave threat. We will go to support those who stand against him, and if the Nether Blade staves off this threat for good... I can only hope that Ethne forgives me."

TEXT.English: "Where you die I will die, and there I will be buried. May the Lord deal with me, be it ever so severely, if anything but death separates you and me."-ancient Umberguard intonement[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dwarves bent down and clutched the ground. They squeezed until their knuckles turned white from the strain and almost crawled across the mountainside refusing to let go with both hands at once. One group sat huddled beneath a rocky outcropping, as if trying to evade a storm, though the day was sunny and beautiful.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Palais Adien stood just outside the tunnel entrance and stared into the sky. He slowly began to sway, then collapsed and vomited all over the ground. His brothers rushed to him, all careful not to look up.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Arturus watched his kin struggle. A wild hare stopped briefly to look at the odd dwarves before hopping away. The dwarves were as equally confused by the bouncing rabbit as it was by the slinking dwarves.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Look out across the plains," Arturus shouted and then he waited for all the dwarves to do as he commanded. From here he could see the green and browns of distant hills, the blues of inland lakes and the rich yellows of fertile valleys. Once the dwarves were all looking Arturus continued.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The mountain does not move. Even as the wind strikes it, as storms rage against it the mountain does not move. With the open sky above and the underhome below, as ages pass, as empires and gods battle the mountain does not move."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At this point Arturus was standing in the open. He could see the fear in his clansmen's eyes as they looked at him. With only his feet touching the earth, as if he would be sucked off into the unknown. But he remained solid and determined.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We will be as the mountain. We will build the first Khazad surface cities here since the Age of Magic. And though we may face the dangers of this world, though creatures or the empires of men may attack we, like the mountain, will not move."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]One by one the dwarves stood then together they walked down the mountainside toward the site of their first city.

TEXT.English: The men were simply gone. Arturus didn't know if their gold ran out or if they simply tired of the war. Such are the ways of men that the passions of one day are forgotten tomorrow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Regardless, the tide of onrushing horsemen had stopped and the Khazad were firmly entrenched upon the surface of Erebus.
TEXT.French: The men were simply gone. Arturus didn't know if their gold ran out or if they simply tired of the war. Such are the ways of men that the passions of one day are forgotten tomorrow.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Regardless, the tide of onrushing horsemen had stopped and the Khazad were firmly entrenched upon the surface of Erebus.
TEXT.German: Die Männer waren einfach weg. Arturus wußte nicht, ob sich ihre Goldvorräte erschöpft hatten oder ob sie einfach nur kriegsmüde geworden waren. So flüchtig sind die Gedanken der Menschen, dass die Leidenschaften des einen Tages am nächsten schon vergessen sind.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dessen ungeachtet ist die Flut von anstürmenden Reitern verschwunden und die Khazad haben auf der Oberfläche von Erebus starke Wurzeln geschlagen.

TEXT.English: Barbarian Assault
TEXT.French: Barbarian Assault
TEXT.German: Angriff der Barbaren
TEXT.Italian: Barbarian Assault
TEXT.Spanish: Barbarian Assault

TEXT.English: These jungles are not as easily tamed as the Umbrawood. This is no place for elves, or men.
TEXT.French: These jungles are not as easily tamed as the Umbrawood. This is no place for elves, or men.
TEXT.German: Dieser Dschungel ist nicht so einfach zu zähmem wie der Umbrawald. Dies ist kein Ort für Elfen, oder Menschen.
TEXT.Italian: These jungles are not as easily tamed as the Umbrawood. This is no place for elves, or men.
TEXT.Spanish: These jungles are not as easily tamed as the Umbrawood. This is no place for elves, or men.

TEXT.English: Even mighty stones wear to the steady pressure of rivers and tides. So are we before the unending hordes of the Clan.
TEXT.French: Even mighty stones wear to the steady pressure of rivers and tides. So are we before the unending hordes of the Clan.
TEXT.German: Selbst gewaltige Felsen werden vom stetigen Druck der Flüsse und Gezeiten abgetragen. So stehen wir vor den endlosen Horden des Klans.
TEXT.Italian: Even mighty stones wear to the steady pressure of rivers and tides. So are we before the unending hordes of the Clan.
TEXT.Spanish: Even mighty stones wear to the steady pressure of rivers and tides. So are we before the unending hordes of the Clan.

TEXT.English: The taint of Labruscum will endure. There must be some small part of Bannor strength left within these beasts.
TEXT.French: The taint of Labruscum will endure. There must be some small part of Bannor strength left within these beasts.
TEXT.German: Der Schandfleck von Labruscum wird überdauern. In diesen Bestien muss noch ein kleiner Teil der bannorischen Stärke übrig sein.
TEXT.Italian: The taint of Labruscum will endure. There must be some small part of Bannor strength left within these beasts.
TEXT.Spanish: The taint of Labruscum will endure. There must be some small part of Bannor strength left within these beasts.

TEXT.English: I will not bear the yoke of Sheelba any longer. You can have this poisoned jungle, there is better hunting elsewhere.
TEXT.French: I will not bear the yoke of Sheelba any longer. You can have this poisoned jungle, there is better hunting elsewhere.
TEXT.German: Ich werde das Joch von Sheelba nicht länger ertragen. Ihr könnt diesen vergifteten Dschungel haben, woanders gibt es bessere Jagdgründe.
TEXT.Italian: I will not bear the yoke of Sheelba any longer. You can have this poisoned jungle, there is better hunting elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: I will not bear the yoke of Sheelba any longer. You can have this poisoned jungle, there is better hunting elsewhere.

TEXT.English: We are best to surrender the Labruscum entirely to the canticle of fire. I would do so, but the Clan may be crazed enough to enjoy it.
TEXT.French: We are best to surrender the Labruscum entirely to the canticle of fire. I would do so, but the Clan may be crazed enough to enjoy it.
TEXT.German: Es wird am besten sein, Labruscum vollständig dem Lobgesang des Feuers zu übergeben. Ich würde es tun, aber der Klan ist wahrscheinlich verrückt genug, um sich daran zu erfreuen.
TEXT.Italian: We are best to surrender the Labruscum entirely to the canticle of fire. I would do so, but the Clan may be crazed enough to enjoy it.
TEXT.Spanish: We are best to surrender the Labruscum entirely to the canticle of fire. I would do so, but the Clan may be crazed enough to enjoy it.

TEXT.English: I pray that you follow me out of this jungle before it is too late. I have no desire to see another barrow raised in this land, or to find you buried beneath it.
TEXT.French: I pray that you follow me out of this jungle before it is too late. I have no desire to see another barrow raised in this land, or to find you buried beneath it.
TEXT.German: Ich bete, dass Ihr mir aus diesem Dschungel folgt, bevor es zu spät ist. Ich habe kein Verlangen danach zu sehen, wie in diesem Land ein weiterer Grabhügel errichtet wird, oder Euch darunter begraben zu finden.
TEXT.Italian: I pray that you follow me out of this jungle before it is too late. I have no desire to see another barrow raised in this land, or to find you buried beneath it.
TEXT.Spanish: I pray that you follow me out of this jungle before it is too late. I have no desire to see another barrow raised in this land, or to find you buried beneath it.

TEXT.English: A thousand will come after me. We will defeat you with our strength our drown you in our blood. There is no victory to be found here.
TEXT.French: A thousand will come after me. We will defeat you with our strength our drown you in our blood. There is no victory to be found here.
TEXT.German: Eintausend werden nach mit kommen. Wir werden Euch mit unserer Stärke und Euch in Eurem eigenen Blut ersäufen. Hier gibt es keinen Sieg zu finden.
TEXT.Italian: A thousand will come after me. We will defeat you with our strength our drown you in our blood. There is no victory to be found here.
TEXT.Spanish: A thousand will come after me. We will defeat you with our strength our drown you in our blood. There is no victory to be found here.

TEXT.English: I am not being paid nearly enough for this war. I leave you to your convictions, I will seek my glory elsewhere.
TEXT.French: I am not being paid nearly enough for this war. I leave you to your convictions, I will seek my glory elsewhere.
TEXT.German: Ich werde für diesen Krieg nicht annähernd gut genug bezahlt. Ich überlasse Euch Eurem Urteil und werde mir meinen Ruhm woanders suchen.
TEXT.Italian: I am not being paid nearly enough for this war. I leave you to your convictions, I will seek my glory elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: I am not being paid nearly enough for this war. I leave you to your convictions, I will seek my glory elsewhere.

TEXT.English: Description: Labruscum has long been the home of the Clan of Embers. If they can be removed here their grip on Erebus will be weakened.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: The lowest ranked player will be removed every 50 turns until only 5 players remain. This does not apply to the Clan of Embers players.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reward: Completing this scenario reduces the amount of Barbarians in all other scenarios.
TEXT.French: Description: Labruscum has long been the home of the Clan of Embers. If they can be removed here their grip on Erebus will be weakened.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: The lowest ranked player will be removed every 50 turns until only 5 players remain. This does not apply to the Clan of Embers players.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reward: Completing this scenario reduces the amount of Barbarians in all other scenarios.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Labruscum ist schon lange die Heimat des Klans der Asche gewesen. Wenn er hier vernichtend geschlagen werden kann, wird sich sein Griff um Erebus lockern.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Der Spieler mit der niedrigsten Wertung wird alle 50 Runden aus der Partie entfernt, bis nur noch 5 Spieler übrig sind. Dies gilt nicht für Spieler, die den Klan der Asche gewählt haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Bei erfolgreichem Abschluss dieses Szenarios verringert sich die Anzahl der Barbaren in allen anderen Szenarien.
TEXT.Italian: Description: Labruscum has long been the home of the Clan of Embers. If they can be removed here their grip on Erebus will be weakened.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: The lowest ranked player will be removed every 50 turns until only 5 players remain. This does not apply to the Clan of Embers players.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reward: Completing this scenario reduces the amount of Barbarians in all other scenarios.

This does not apply to the Clan of Embers players.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reward: Completing this scenario reduces the amount of Barbarians in all other scenarios.

TEXT.English: Defeat Sheelba!
TEXT.French: Defeat Sheelba!
TEXT.German: Besiege Sheelba!
TEXT.Italian: Defeat Sheelba!
TEXT.Spanish: Defeat Sheelba!

TEXT.English: The jungles of Labruscum cover what once was the heart of the Bannor empire. The fall of the Queen of Fire reduced that nation to ash and transformed her followers into a savage mix of orcs, goblins and other savage humanoids. Now Labruscum serves as the recruiting ground for the Clan of Embers, and if the Clan is to be stopped they must be defeated here.
TEXT.French: The jungles of Labruscum cover what once was the heart of the Bannor empire. The fall of the Queen of Fire reduced that nation to ash and transformed her followers into a savage mix of orcs, goblins and other savage humanoids. Now Labruscum serves as the recruiting ground for the Clan of Embers, and if the Clan is to be stopped they must be defeated here.
TEXT.German: Der Dschungel von Labruscum verbirgt, was einst das Herz des bannorischen Reiches war. Der Sturz der Königin des Feuers verwandelte diese Nation zu Asche und ihre Anhänger zu einer wilden Mischung aus Orks, Goblins und anderen Primitiven. Heute dient Labruscum als Rekrutierungsstätte des Klans der Asche. Falls der Klan gestoppt werden soll, muss er hier besiegt werden.
TEXT.Italian: The jungles of Labruscum cover what once was the heart of the Bannor empire. The fall of the Queen of Fire reduced that nation to ash and transformed her followers into a savage mix of orcs, goblins and other savage humanoids. Now Labruscum serves as the recruiting ground for the Clan of Embers, and if the Clan is to be stopped they must be defeated here.
TEXT.Spanish: The jungles of Labruscum cover what once was the heart of the Bannor empire. The fall of the Queen of Fire reduced that nation to ash and transformed her followers into a savage mix of orcs, goblins and other savage humanoids. Now Labruscum serves as the recruiting ground for the Clan of Embers, and if the Clan is to be stopped they must be defeated here.

TEXT.English: Labruscum is under your control. Without their wildlands the Clan's grip on Erebus is weakened and your homeland will be spared the worst of their raids. Civilization will rise again from the jungle ruins.
TEXT.French: Labruscum is under your control. Without their wildlands the Clan's grip on Erebus is weakened and your homeland will be spared the worst of their raids. Civilization will rise again from the jungle ruins.
TEXT.German: Labruscum ist unter Eurer Kontrolle. Ohne seine Rückzugsgebiete in der Wildnis ist der Griff des Klans um Erebus geschwächt und Eure Heimat wird in Zukunft von den schlimmsten Überfällen verschont bleiben. Die Zivilisation wird sich erneut aus den Dschungelruinen erheben.
TEXT.Italian: Labruscum is under your control. Without their wildlands the Clan's grip on Erebus is weakened and your homeland will be spared the worst of their raids. Civilization will rise again from the jungle ruins.
TEXT.Spanish: Labruscum is under your control. Without their wildlands the Clan's grip on Erebus is weakened and your homeland will be spared the worst of their raids. Civilization will rise again from the jungle ruins.

TEXT.English: Beneath the Heel
TEXT.French: Beneath the Heel
TEXT.German: Unter dem Absatz
TEXT.Italian: Beneath the Heel
TEXT.Spanish: Beneath the Heel

TEXT.English: I should have known better than to trust mercenaries for my defense. You are too weak to serve a god.
TEXT.French: I should have known better than to trust mercenaries for my defense. You are too weak to serve a god.
TEXT.German: Ich hätte es besser wissen und meine Verteidigung nicht Söldnern anvertrauen sollen. Ihr seid zu schwach, um einem Gott zu dienen.
TEXT.Italian: I should have known better than to trust mercenaries for my defense. You are too weak to serve a god.
TEXT.Spanish: I should have known better than to trust mercenaries for my defense. You are too weak to serve a god.

TEXT.English: We stood alone against the Illians at the end of the Age of Magic. We will rise up again.
TEXT.French: We stood alone against the Illians at the end of the Age of Magic. We will rise up again.
TEXT.German: Wir standen den Illianern am Ende des Zeitalters der Magie allein gegenüber. Wir werden erneut aufsteigen.
TEXT.Italian: We stood alone against the Illians at the end of the Age of Magic. We will rise up again.
TEXT.Spanish: We stood alone against the Illians at the end of the Age of Magic. We will rise up again.

TEXT.English: Is the hope of man so easily lost? Given away for a few gold and sold to simple bandits. Is this how we will lose this age?
TEXT.French: Is the hope of man so easily lost? Given away for a few gold and sold to simple bandits. Is this how we will lose this age?
TEXT.German: Ist die Hoffnung der Menschen so schnell verloren? Verschenkt für ein bisschen Gold und verkauft an einfache Banditen. Wird uns dieses Zeitalter etwa so entgleiten?
TEXT.Italian: Is the hope of man so easily lost? Given away for a few gold and sold to simple bandits. Is this how we will lose this age?
TEXT.Spanish: Is the hope of man so easily lost? Given away for a few gold and sold to simple bandits. Is this how we will lose this age?

TEXT.English: My golems would have crushed you, if you would only stand still...
TEXT.French: My golems would have crushed you, if you would only stand still...
TEXT.German: Meine Golems hätten Euch zu Staub zermahlen, wenn Ihr nur still gestanden wärt...
TEXT.Italian: My golems would have crushed you, if you would only stand still...
TEXT.Spanish: My golems would have crushed you, if you would only stand still...

TEXT.English: Each man eventually becomes food for another, today my legacy is ended.
TEXT.French: Each man eventually becomes food for another, today my legacy is ended.
TEXT.German: Jeder Mensch wird schließlich zur Beute eines anderen. Heute ist mein Vermächtnis beendet.
TEXT.Italian: Each man eventually becomes food for another, today my legacy is ended.
TEXT.Spanish: Each man eventually becomes food for another, today my legacy is ended.

TEXT.English: You are a puppet for the White Hand, they will sacrifice you when it serves their needs.
TEXT.French: You are a puppet for the White Hand, they will sacrifice you when it serves their needs.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid nur eine Marionette für die Weiße Hand. Sie werden Euch opfern, wenn es ihnen gelegen kommt.
TEXT.Italian: You are a puppet for the White Hand, they will sacrifice you when it serves their needs.
TEXT.Spanish: You are a puppet for the White Hand, they will sacrifice you when it serves their needs.

TEXT.English: Description: Regain the Pieces of Barnaxus for Auric Ulvin.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: You cannot train units, instead they must be purchased.
