TEXT.German: Bald!
TEXT.Italian: They had struck deeper into the Fane than any human army ever had. They had allies to watch their back, to guard the other passes. Brave Malakim champions, Balseraph mimics unpredictable but strangely reliable, and of course the heavenly armies of the Mercurians, giving grudging respect to their comrades. But the Bannor were ever at the vanguard. It was what they lived for. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Not one among this army had seen the fires of hell before, save the Commander. Those men and women who had crossed from that wretched land into world of Erebus were a dying generation. But the story of their journey survived in tales every young Bannor boy and girl learned, learned well and knew better than to doubt in the presence of their elders. The fierce dedication that had seen these people through constant war held them still enthralled, as well. This history and national character came together, leaving the Bannor knights, crusaders, and priests unflinching as they marched though the Fane, unrelenting, until even the terrible arch-angel Hyborem was overthrown. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Capria surveyed the ruins of Dis, the sprawling city Hyborem had ruled. Its dungeons were labyrinthine, and its streets filled with fiendish traps. Vile sights met the Bannor at every turn, men crucified and impaled, hanging from towers and buried up to their necks. It would be long and grim work razing the city while sanctifying those souls trapped here. But it brought some satisfaction to dismantle the apparatus of Hell on earth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They had not found what she came to find, but what they had accomplished was monumental, world changing. Surely more important than a personal quest to repay a priceless debt. She sighed and turned the corner, bringing the palace into view, the last refuge of the Fane. It had been pummeled by Bannor catapults, but in the ruins sat a wavering portal. The mages that accompanied her set about closing it, when from the rubble a group of hell hounds charged towards them. Capria threw herself in the way of the mages, buying time for them to get to cover. She braced for impact behind her shield, but the hound was felled from behind by a hurled spear. The other hounds rushed past her, fleeing, not attacking. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Capria lowered her shield and gasped as she saw who it was, even as she had hoped to find him. TEXT.English: At first, I thought I had arrived at Amathaon's heaven. I had cheated, stolen, committed crimes beyond count, even sent Perpentach's idiot daughter to face Hell itself, and yet I had made it to paradise! Maybe the gods were rewarding me for ridding them of that spoiled brat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I beheld gardens, beautiful statuary, a sky that held fairy-tale clouds, and great angels dressed in pink and white. Great angels, with horns and large teeth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The gardens, I noticed as my vision cleared, grew gulagarms, razorweed, and other, even more hellish plants. The statuary depicted not handsome men and beautiful women, but succubi and demon princes. The sky, I saw, was actually more red than pink, and the clouds were coming from an active volcano.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This was not the hell I had imagined awaiting me, but it was hell nonetheless. One of the great demons, absurdly dressed but still terrifying, marched towards me. "Princess Keelyn wants you to dance," it said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Princess... Keelyn?" I muttered, unable to believe what I'd heard. I was dragged to a great central hall, where upon a demonic throne made for giants was placed another throne, of mortal scale, that looked like it had come from a giant doll-house. Keelyn sat upon that throne. I could not believe it, Princess Keelyn was sitting on Hyborem's throne. I had sent her off to die, and she had overthrown the Lord of the Balors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You're that advisor. The one who gave me the boat."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes," I said. "Remember all the fun we had together..."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You didn't like me," she said. "You were always mean to me. The only nice thing you did was give me that boat..." she leaned close and then smiled, "and that was because you thought I'd die."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I stared, unsure how to respond to the new Lady of the Balors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Dance," she ordered. I danced. I'm not sure how long for. She clapped and was clearly amused, but demanded I keep dancing. So I did. I kept dancing until I collapsed, unable to continue. "Don't stop! Keep dancing!" she demanded. But I couldn't. "Guards," she yelled, "he won't dance! Throw him in the Naughty Pit!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As I was dragged away by a Balor, I knew that the Naughty Pit was going to be far worse than dancing until collapse. The screams to which I was being dragged towards suggested that, as did the cruelly stupid grin upon the Balor's face.

TEXT.English: For the first time the sun rose bright and shining on the Fane, not through the acrid red haze that chocked the land. The blistering sores that covered the Fane began to cool and heal. There was still a palatable feeling of loss but it was as if remembered from a dream now past.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With the light came angels, not the barbaric ones that traveled with Basium, but gentle compassionate creatures that tended to the wounded men and spirits alike. The darkest spirits had been dragged into hell when the Throne of Hell was destroyed, but thousands still remained, those stolen unfairly by the demons or trapped between the ideals of heaven and the failure of hell.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I walked among them, blessed souls seeking forgiveness, shared the pain with those who had carried it alone for so long. Other members of my army were the same, weary but unwilling to stop tending to these souls. It was as if we rescued a kingdom under a cruel despot, but no one had suffered as horribly as these souls had. For many it was the first kindness they had experienced in centuries.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As I walked I saw a twisted dark tree on the wastes. Ropes hung from its limbs and it looked, as the rest of this world, to be deeply tortured. An adept sanctified the ground around the tree, turning it from charred to deep green and the tree disappeared. From where it was Talia's spirit walked toward me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]We stared at each other in silence. I was exhausted and battle scared, she was a pale ghost, floating just above the ground in sheer robes that clung to her. She looked like a grey shadow of herself on the day we wed, strong and beautiful.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I will always love you." I said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She smiled slightly but there was sadness in her eyes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The adepts spell spread and the ground below my feet began to change and grow with life as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am the world now," she said, "the rivers, the trees, the mountains. Save these lands and you save me, sleep in heliotrope fields and you will dream of me. I will ever love and dream of you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With that she was gone and I fell to my knees and wept. But around me the land continued to change and small lavender flowers grew around me, filling the air with their scent and I knew she was nearby.

Save these lands and you save me, sleep in heliotrope fields and you will dream of me. I will ever love and dream of you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With that she was gone and I fell to my knees and wept. But around me the land continued to change and small lavender flowers grew around me, filling the air with their scent and I knew she was nearby.

TEXT.English: This pass is wide and lined with banners from various kingdoms. Each a trophy from an army that marched into the Fane and never returned. Distant cheers still echo through the pass, the hubris of other nations broken against the might of the Infernals.

TEXT.English: The Balseraphs stared at the countless banners covering the pass.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Look at all of them! It's just like a carnival!" Keelyn said, giggling.[PARAGRAPH:1]Her men were more concerned; most of the banners were foreign to them, kingdoms long since passed into legend.[PARAGRAPH:1]But Keelyn cheerfully surveyed her surroundings. "Some of those banners are really pretty. I want them! All we have to do is take them! How hard can it be?"[PARAGRAPH:1]An imp in a pastel tutu materialized beside her. "Those banners are of the countless kingdoms that have been defeated here. Once mighty nations, their very names are now forgotten." The imp grinned, and with a snap of its fingers, summoned a chest. Inside there was a finely crafted Infernal banner.[PARAGRAPH:1]Keelyn examined the pass before pointing to a spot between a black banner with an old brass lantern, and a sea-blue banner with an absurd buck-toothed green fish. "I think it will look nice right there."

TEXT.English: I rage eternal. In whatever form I am reborn I will march again against the infernal.
TEXT.French: I rage eternal. In whatever form I am reborn I will march again against the infernal.
TEXT.German: Ich werde ewig wüten. Egal in welcher Form ich wiedergeboren werde, ich werde erneut gegen die Infernalen ins Feld ziehen.
TEXT.Italian: I rage eternal. In whatever form I am reborn I will march again against the infernal.
TEXT.Spanish: I rage eternal. In whatever form I am reborn I will march again against the infernal.

TEXT.English: It was pride that lead me once again into hell. I only regret all of the lives it cost us.
TEXT.French: It was pride that lead me once again into hell. I only regret all of the lives it cost us.
TEXT.German: Es war der Stolz, der mich nun wieder in die Hölle geführt hat. Ich bedauere nur all die Leben, die es uns gekostet hat.
TEXT.Italian: It was pride that lead me once again into hell. I only regret all of the lives it cost us.
TEXT.Spanish: It was pride that lead me once again into hell. I only regret all of the lives it cost us.

TEXT.English: The waves have now a redder glow, the hours are breathing faint and low. And when, amid no earthly moans, down, down that town shall settle hence. Hell, rising from a thousand thrones, shall do it reverence.

TEXT.German: Zurück in die Finsternis gehe ich. Dieses einfach Schicksal wird nicht das Ende meiner Legende sein.

TEXT.Spanish: Back into the darkness I go. This simple fate will not be the end of my legend.

TEXT.English: This place is no fun at all and the red boys have broken my toys. I will be a princess somewhere else!
TEXT.French: This place is no fun at all and the red boys have broken my toys. I will be a princess somewhere else!
TEXT.German: Dieser Ort macht überhaupt keinen Spaß und die roten Jungs haben meine Spielsachen kaputt gemacht. Ich werde woanders eine Prinzessin sein!

TEXT.English: The dead do not weep, but are wept for. Let us see who will weep for me.
TEXT.French: The dead do not weep, but are wept for. Let us see who will weep for me.
TEXT.German: Die Toten weinen nicht, sondern werden beweint. Mal sehen, wer um mich weint.
TEXT.Italian: The dead do not weep, but are wept for. Let us see who will weep for me.
TEXT.Spanish: The dead do not weep, but are wept for. Let us see who will weep for me.

TEXT.English: No one can stand against entropy, only that which consumes is eternal.
TEXT.French: No one can stand against entropy, only that which consumes is eternal.
TEXT.German: Niemand kann die Entropie aufhalten. Nur das, was andere verzehrt, ist ewig.
TEXT.Italian: No one can stand against entropy, only that which consumes is eternal.
TEXT.Spanish: No one can stand against entropy, only that which consumes is eternal.

TEXT.English: I was forged in Camulos's hell, how could lesser beings defeat me?
TEXT.French: I was forged in Camulos's hell, how could lesser beings defeat me?
TEXT.German: Ich wurde in in Camulos' Hölle geschmiedet. Wie könnten mich niedere Wesen besiegen?
TEXT.Italian: I was forged in Camulos's hell, how could lesser beings defeat me?
TEXT.Spanish: I was forged in Camulos's hell, how could lesser beings defeat me?

TEXT.English: I will miss my palace most, Erebus has never seen a greater lair of depravity and cruelty then that which I designed.
TEXT.French: I will miss my palace most, Erebus has never seen a greater lair of depravity and cruelty then that which I designed.
TEXT.German: Ich werde meinen Palast am meisten vermissen. Erebus ist niemals Zeuge eines großartigeren Monuments der Verderbtheit und der Grausamkeit geworden als jenes, das ich entworfen habe.
TEXT.Italian: I will miss my palace most, Erebus has never seen a greater lair of depravity and cruelty then that which I designed.
TEXT.Spanish: I will miss my palace most, Erebus has never seen a greater lair of depravity and cruelty then that which I designed.

TEXT.English: You purge this desire from me only to take it up yourself. No man turns away from power, it is the chain Agares binds us with. Where one demon lord falls another rises.
TEXT.French: You purge this desire from me only to take it up yourself. No man turns away from power, it is the chain Agares binds us with. Where one demon lord falls another rises.
TEXT.German: Ihr nehmt mir dieses Verlangen nur, um es Euch selbst zu eigen zu machen. Niemand wendet sich von der Macht ab. Es ist die Leine, mit der uns Agares an sich bindet. Wo ein Dämonenfürst versagt, steigt ein anderer auf.

TEXT.Spanish: You purge this desire from me only to take it up yourself. No man turns away from power, it is the chain Agares binds us with. Where one demon lord falls another rises.

TEXT.English: Talia... I was too weak to avenge you.
TEXT.French: Talia... I was too weak to avenge you.
TEXT.German: Talia... ich war zu schwach, um Euch zu rächen.
TEXT.Italian: Talia... I was too weak to avenge you.
TEXT.Spanish: Talia... I was too weak to avenge you.

TEXT.English: This pass looks to be abandoned. As your army moves through a few spirits can be seen drifting between the various alcoves set in the high walls. They are hiding here from their demonic masters, and angered that your passing may draw attention to them.
TEXT.French: This pass looks to be abandoned. As your army moves through a few spirits can be seen drifting between the various alcoves set in the high walls. They are hiding here from their demonic masters, and angered that your passing may draw attention to them.
TEXT.German: Dieser Pass scheint verlassen zu sein. Als Eure Armee ihn passiert, bemerkt Ihr einige Geister, die zwischen den verschiedenen Nischen der Steilwand hin und her schweben. Sie verstecken sich hier vor ihren dämonischen Herren und sind erzürnt, dass Eure Durchquerung vielleicht die Aufmerksamkeit auf sie lenken wird.

TEXT.English: The souls hiding in this pass are cowards hiding from their demonic lords. At first they mistook Keelyn for a succubus queen and fled. Keelyn, curious to see what these timid shapes bounding away in terror are, ordered a few of them captured. Upon capture, one of the souls struggled for words.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Your malevolence," he began, "we are of no interest to you... let us be, we are unworthy."[PARAGRAPH:1]"I will," Keelyn responded, "if you agree to be good little spirits and serve me."[PARAGRAPH:1]"We have always served you and your masters, lady..." one of the souls stammered.[PARAGRAPH:1]Keelyn took out a runic knife and sliced the spirit, which screamed in pain.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I don't have a master," Keelyn said, "and soon these lands will be mine. I don't have to follow anyones rules."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Very well, than we kneel before you... as... the new Queen of the Fane of the Lessers, glorious mistress of..." another slice, another scream of pain.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I prefer Princess of the Fane. Queens are old and tired, princesses are young and pretty. And forget the Lessers, it doesn't sound very impressive."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes, yes... whatever you wish... you are the Princess of the Fane, your beauty is beyond words, your power is beyond our mere comprehension, just please don't hurt us."[PARAGRAPH:1]"I won't, if you do one thing."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Why, anything, your grace!"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I'm bored. Sing me a song." With a casual spin of a dagger, she adds, "and make sure it's a good one."

TEXT.English: I am forever held within the ravages of war. I am the last warrior of the Godswar and I will carry this battle across Erebus, through every civilization of men, into the stronghold of the Infernals and into hell itself if needed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But I am no fool. Men are weak, painfully short sighted and prone to betrayal for meaningless reasons. They trade their virtue for dirt, for skirt, or far less. Despite their weakness Erebus is their world, so the compact has decreed. And where the death of my angels is a loss forever, the tides of men seem endless. What need is there for immortality when the generations pouring forth from their dirty cities come faster than they can be extinguished, and each more pallid and anemic than the last. But this war cannot be won without them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There seems some small hope in this generation. Glorious Sabathiel has guided the Bannor through hell itself, and these men survived the trip. Now they mean to sail to the Fane of Lessers, to rescue a companion thought long lost. To walk an army into Hyborem's lands and take what they wish.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]And even spineless Lugus has a High Priest among the Malakim willing to stand against the demons. He sails for the Fane as well, but for revenge. It is a lesser reason than the salvation of the world, but it will do. It amazes me how men can become so passionate about the plight of one soul but so blatantly ignore the rest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Regardless I have long watched the Fane, as a shepherd watches the forest that houses the wolves. With two strong armies moving against the demons the Mercurians will join. These men I command have lost what they love to the Infernal. They fight on raw passion, and will serve me well in life, and continue to serve as angels if they fall on the battlefield. The Bannor and the Malakim may only distract the Infernals, but we have the opportunity we seek. The war set into motion at the signing of the compact reaches its conclusion here. I will lead an army into the Fane of Lessers, I will purge the Infernal from Erebus.

To walk an army into Hyborem's lands and take what they wish.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]And even spineless Lugus has a High Priest among the Malakim willing to stand against the demons. He sails for the Fane as well, but for revenge. It is a lesser reason than the salvation of the world, but it will do. It amazes me how men can become so passionate about the plight of one soul but so blatantly ignore the rest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Regardless I have long watched the Fane, as a shepherd watches the forest that houses the wolves. With two strong armies moving against the demons the Mercurians will join. These men I command have lost what they love to the Infernal. They fight on raw passion, and will serve me well in life, and continue to serve as angels if they fall on the battlefield. The Bannor and the Malakim may only distract the Infernals, but we have the opportunity we seek. The war set into motion at the signing of the compact reaches its conclusion here. I will lead an army into the Fane of Lessers, I will purge the Infernal from Erebus.
TEXT.Italian: I am forever held within the ravages of war. I am the last warrior of the Godswar and I will carry this battle across Erebus, through every civilization of men, into the stronghold of the Infernals and into hell itself if needed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But I am no fool. Men are weak, painfully short sighted and prone to betrayal for meaningless reasons. They trade their virtue for dirt, for skirt, or far less. Despite their weakness Erebus is their world, so the compact has decreed. And where the death of my angels is a loss forever, the tides of men seem endless. What need is there for immortality when the generations pouring forth from their dirty cities come faster than they can be extinguished, and each more pallid and anemic than the last. TEXT.English: Capria screamed. It took her a few seconds to adjust to the dim light of her bedchamber. She was alone but her dreams still echoed through her mind. Visions of demons in that final escape from hell, of the closing portal and Donal Lugh beyond it trapped forever in hell. She could still hear him calling for her.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Guards rushed into the room, weapons at the ready.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Lady Capria, are you alright?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She steadied herself, she was still out of breath from the dream and covered in sweat. But these men believed her to be almost as inhuman as Sabathiel himself, and she wouldn't let them see her weak.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Of course I'm fine, return to your post."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The guards apologized and left. Capria lay back down but she was unable to escape the dream. Back asleep she saw Donal again, but this time there was no portal. He was in a land defiled but it was not hell, surrounded by vast mountains but here on Erebus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the morning she knew what she had to do. That Donal Lugh, who was trapped in hell so long ago, was still alive. She quickly dressed and headed to the shipyard, she needed a galleon and a few troops to rescue him. And woe to any demon who stood between her and the Bannor's greatest hero.

TEXT.English: "I'm getting a new pet," Princess Keelyn happily announced one day. "Don't worry, Chuckles, you're still my favorite. But this new one is going to be really fun!" She bounded eagerly down the steps to her summoning chamber.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Her newest circle was the largest one I'd ever seen. Normally, she summons imps, other balors, and occasionally elementals. But this new circle was bigger even than the one she summoned me with. I remember it clearly; I'd been so full of anger, so hateful then. But Keelyn taught me to be happy. And I was happy. And now I served her, since she was nice to me as long as I wasn't naughty.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I examined the runes, they read "Hyborem." I'd heard that name... I thought back. It was hard, remembering the bad days. But the name... scared me for some reason.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who are you summoning, Mistress?" I asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I was reading this book my from my daddy's library, and it said the biggest demon of them all was Hyborem. So I'm going to summon him."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hyborem. Why did that seem like a bad idea? All the other demons Keelyn summoned learned to love their new master. But for some reason, I was worried. Hyborem must have been scary in the bad days, even scarier than I was. Keelyn snapped her fingers, and her puppets jolted into motion. They began dancing as Keelyn chanted the words of the summoning spell. And the Lord of the Balors appeared before us.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hyborem was big. Huge. He barely fit in the summoning circle. He roared as he struggled against the bounds.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who dares call me from my palace? What mortal is arrogant enough to..." he looked down. "What have we here, a little girl, mixed blood of the insane and the profane? This is a fine sacrifice. Release me, and I'll take my sacrifice and decide your fate. Your agony will only be temporary, and I'll let you live for now. Just remember... next time you summon me, ask, do not command." Hyborem looked at me and rose to his full height. "You! Throw me my sacrifice, and then reveal this foolish mage."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Why are you giving me orders?" I asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hyborem stared. He ragged against the circle. The bonds constrained him, a fact that only infuriated Hyborem more. "You dare question your lord?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No," I said. "I obey Princess Keelyn."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hyborem looked at me, noticed the pink bow around my horns, and then glanced at the matching bow in Keelyn's hair. He brought his face as close to Keelyn as the summoning circle would allow. "Pedicabo ego vos et irrumabo. In the history of Erebus, none have been as arrogant as you. You take my servants from me and summon me like some common imp?" Again, Hyborem thrashed at the circle. But Princess Keelyn's circles held. He growled. "There is no agony in hell horrible enough for you. I will suffocate you on the excrement of Abyssus, you will spend ages in a pit filled with the screaming aborted fetuses of depraved whores. I will devise a new punishment, just for you... and that treasonous idiot." With that, Hyborem muttered a spell and vanished.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Where'd he go?" Keelyn asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I looked back into my memories. "The Fane of Lessers," I answered, though the words meant nothing to me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Keelyn leaped up the stairs before running into a pair of Perpentach's advisors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My princess," one said, "we weren't expecting you to be done so soon."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My new pet got away," Keelyn said, "and I need to go punish him."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Where'd he go?" asked the other advisor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Fane of Lessers. His name is Hyborem and he has a very naughty mouth."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The advisors stared at each other. "You would chase Hyborem to his own realm because... he wouldn't play tea party?! You could get killed..." the other advisor elbowed the speaker in the stomach. They glanced conspiratorially at each other. They briefly spoke in whispers, before saying, with suspicious smiles, "we'll arrange for a galleon and some... volunteers... to help you." As we left, I could have sworn I heard one mutter, "what if she succeeds?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The other snickered. "Don't worry. She's as good as dead."

Your agony will only be temporary, and I'll let you live for now. Just remember... next time you summon me, ask, do not command." Hyborem looked at me and rose to his full height. "You! Throw me my sacrifice, and then reveal this foolish mage."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Why are you giving me orders?" I asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hyborem stared. He ragged against the circle. The bonds constrained him, a fact that only infuriated Hyborem more. "You dare question your lord?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No," I said. "I obey Princess Keelyn."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Hyborem looked at me, noticed the pink bow around my horns, and then glanced at the matching bow in Keelyn's hair. He brought his face as close to Keelyn as the summoning circle would allow. "Pedicabo ego vos et irrumabo. In the history of Erebus, none have been as arrogant as you. You take my servants from me and summon me like some common imp?" Again, Hyborem thrashed at the circle. But Princess Keelyn's circles held. He growled. "There is no agony in hell horrible enough for you. I will suffocate you on the excrement of Abyssus, you will spend ages in a pit filled with the screaming aborted fetuses of depraved whores. I will devise a new punishment, just for you... and that treasonous idiot." With that, Hyborem muttered a spell and vanished.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Where'd he go?" Keelyn asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I looked back into my memories. "The Fane of Lessers," I answered, though the words meant nothing to me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Keelyn leaped up the stairs before running into a pair of Perpentach's advisors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My princess," one said, "we weren't expecting you to be done so soon."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My new pet got away," Keelyn said, "and I need to go punish him."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Where'd he go?" asked the other advisor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Fane of Lessers. His name is Hyborem and he has a very naughty mouth."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The advisors stared at each other. "You would chase Hyborem to his own realm because... he wouldn't play tea party?! You could get killed..." the other advisor elbowed the speaker in the stomach. They glanced conspiratorially at each other. They briefly spoke in whispers, before saying, with suspicious smiles, "we'll arrange for a galleon and some... volunteers... to help you." As we left, I could have sworn I heard one mutter, "what if she succeeds?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The other snickered. "Don't worry. She's as good as dead."

TEXT.English: I forgave her, but she couldn't forgive herself.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It wasn't unusual for Talia to worship at dusk. She revered it as I revered the dawn. She said that as the world slept the spirits came out to wander across it and often slipped into bed late, warm from the magic she channeled and smelling of the heliotrope flowers that covered the shrine she kept in the temple. She was beautiful and I loved her.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I arose one morning to find that she never came to bed. It was three days since she told me about her affair and through many tears, both in anger and sadness, we worked through it. I promised myself that I would forget what she had done, that I would trust her again. But in seeing the empty bed my mind leapt to suspicions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I found her body laying before her shrine. She had expended her spirit entirely in casting, let her life flow from her for no reason other than to give it up. There was a short note with her, it read simply "I'm sorry."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There was no salvation for her. And I shed tears once again at the altar of Lugus. Angels tended to me, brilliant compassionate beings who cried along with me. In time we divined Talia's last hours. She hated the pain she caused me and prayed for some relief. But the druidic spirits consoled only time and patience to heal those wounds. Another voice had offered a more immediate solution.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That was the demoness Lethe, Queen of Sorrow. She whispered to Talia as she had thousands before. Bade her to forget her life and enter the abyss to escape her pain. And Talia followed it, killing herself at the shrine, believing somehow that she was making it easier for me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Now we sail towards an idyllic beach. The tides beat regularly against white sand that rises smoothly to a thick ridge of mountain. It's hard to believe that the Fane of Lessers, the place where Agares dwelt during the Godswar, where the souls of the damned are drawn, lies beyond those mountains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This may be madness. To assault the stronghold of evil with only those few volunteers that could join me on this galleon. But Lethe is somewhere within that twisted hellish terrain, and I will make sure that her voice, and those the demon lords that dwell with her, will be removed from Erebus.

TEXT.English: The faith in Lugus, god of the dawn, spreads through your people. They rally to your flag and offer their aide in your war against the Infernal.
TEXT.French: The faith in Lugus, god of the dawn, spreads through your people. They rally to your flag and offer their aide in your war against the Infernal.
TEXT.German: Der Glaube an Lugus, den Gott der Morgendämmerung, verbreitet sich unter Eurem Volk. Sie versammeln sich unter Eurem Banner und bieten Euch ihre Unterstützung für Euren Krieg gegen die Infernalen an.
TEXT.Italian: The faith in Lugus, god of the dawn, spreads through your people. They rally to your flag and offer their aide in your war against the Infernal.
TEXT.Spanish: The faith in Lugus, god of the dawn, spreads through your people. They rally to your flag and offer their aide in your war against the Infernal.

TEXT.English: You are not alone. The Order sends soldiers to aide you. They are steadfast and loyal troops.

TEXT.German: Ihr seid nicht allein. Die Weisung entsendet Soldaten zu Eurer Unterstützung. Es sind unerschütterliche und loyale Truppen.
TEXT.Italian: You are not alone. The Order sends soldiers to aide you. They are steadfast and loyal troops.
TEXT.Spanish: You are not alone. The Order sends soldiers to aide you. They are steadfast and loyal troops.

TEXT.English: A priest and a pair of brine-covered men play in the ocean waves. Curiosity brings them to your city where they tell strange stories and you decide to let them stay, even if they do smell funny.
TEXT.French: A priest and a pair of brine-covered men play in the ocean waves. Curiosity brings them to your city where they tell strange stories and you decide to let them stay, even if they do smell funny.
TEXT.German: Ein Priester und zwei salzverkrustete Männer spielen in der Meeresbrandung. Die Neugier treibt sie in Eure Stadt, wo sie merkwürdige Geschichten erzählen. Ihr entscheidet sie bleiben zu lassen, obwohl sie komisch riechen.

TEXT.English: This pass is used by souls that committed suicide. The walls on each side are steep with sharp ledges high above the floor of the pass. At night the souls unwilling to enter the Fane can be seen here reliving their last moments of life. Many souls hang from the ledges, still twitching in eternal death throes.[PARAGRAPH:1]A girl in a pale dress jumps from a ledge screaming, hitting the ground near your men only to reform again on the ledge and repeat the action. A mother, her face swollen with bruises, drinks from a vial then falls asleep surrounded by the cries of her children.

TEXT.English: The Balseraph soldiers stood entranced by the singing of the demon Lethe; a song of sorrows and cruelties of the mortal world, and the painlessness of oblivion. Some soldiers felt an urge to obey her calls, others only a creeping dread. But as terrible as it was, it was also hauntingly beautiful.[PARAGRAPH:1]Keelyn, apparently immune to the enchantment of demons, only said, "she sings nice. Even better than my little birdy. Bring her to me, so she can be my new little birdy. Have a big cage made, she won't fit in the old one."[PARAGRAPH:1]The most strong-willed soldiers were snapped out of their awe by Keelyn's command, and the fear of being fed to Balors. They began preparing for their princess's wish. The wisest began looking for metal for a cage, excusing themselves from the potential battle. To deal with those that remained entranced, Keelyn placed a curse upon one of the them. So wrapped up in the song, he hardly noticed the spell... until Keelyn activated the curse, sending unimaginable pain through his body, while leaving him unable to die, or even slip into unconsciousness. He screamed, drowning out the siren's song and breaking the trance.

TEXT.English: Commander Achare led the hunters personally; he wanted to see the lay of the land of a site that would almost certainly be a battlefield in the coming weeks. He didn't know that they were walking into a Doviello ambush-but that wouldn't have stopped him. Life was struggle, and Bannor commanders don't survive it by leading from the rear. They survive it by being very good fighters as well as leaders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]And by being lucky when they need to be. A horde of Sons of Asena sprang from the woods, icy winds at their back. The Bannor hunters formed ranks quickly, sending in their wolves to skirmish as they fired at their attackers with short bows. Doviello men were not deterred by charging wolves, and the Bannor prepared to go down fighting.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But the Doviello stopped their charge, turned and faced new threat from behind them. Emerging from the darkness came Moroi, the savage foot soldiers of the Calabim. The Doviello were quickly dispatched, as the Moroi matched their ferocity with surprise.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Bannor commander kept his men alert. Though they hadn't had a reason to enter Calabim lands, he wasn't ignorant of the world. The Calabim were monsters, and he would happily lead a crusade into their cities if ordered. Worse, they had sided with the Sheaim and Infernal in Tempus Mor, the very battle he had been training to join when Auric led his armies into Torrolerial and sacked the great city, seemingly slaying the Bannor leader Sabathiel in the process. But no blood had been spilled between them yet, and he awaited some announcement from their saviors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Men of the Bannor," the Calabim commander began, emerging from the ranks of his soldiers, then stopped. TEXT.English: Commander Achare led the hunters personally; he wanted to see the lay of the land of a site that would almost certainly be a battlefield in the coming weeks. He didn't know that they were walking into a Doviello ambush-but that wouldn't have stopped him. Life was struggle, and Bannor commanders don't survive it by leading from the rear. They survive it by being very good fighters as well as leaders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]And by being lucky when they need to be. A horde of Sons of Asena sprang from the woods, icy winds at their back. The Bannor hunters formed ranks quickly, sending in their wolves to skirmish as they fired at their attackers with short bows. Doviello men were not deterred by charging wolves, and the Bannor prepared to go down fighting.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But the Doviello stopped their charge, turned and faced a new threat from behind them. Malakim warriors, dressed for the arctic battle in lion fur coats, descended upon the Doviello. The wild men turn on them in a rage, but the newcomers to the Aquillo tundra hold their lines, showing a discipline matching the Bannor's. The Bannor commander ordered his hunters to strike, and the Doviello ambush is turned to a rout, with Malakim cavalry chasing down the survivors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Commander Samatheon Achare stepped forward to offer thanks to their saviors, but stopped when he saw who stepped out to greet him. "I see the Bannor sent their best to stop the end of the world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Decius? By Junil, I had feared you dead."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. I am not dead. I have traveled the ends of the earth to seek refuge from false accusations, but I live and am better for it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"False accusations. Not false, for I accused you in good faith, but wrong nonetheless. Arret, Rosier's uncle, was revealed a necromancer in the sacking of Torrolerial. But the evidence before my eyes could not be ignored. A man cannot show favoritism to his own kin over the rule of law-that is the way of anarchy and tyranny. I have long grieved for what transpired between us-that you would see your own father as your persecutor, that the promise your life showed should be wasted."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I understand. I cannot say I regret my flee from justice, but I absolve you. The Bannor notion of righteousness is lacking-incomplete. But you served me well in my youth, and gave me a love of goodness and honor that I was able to preserve, despite everything. My time with the Malakim, these men who now follow me, allowed me to grasp the complete vision-justice paired with redemption and reconciliation. It will be good to speak of these matters further with you, should we survive this war with Auric."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes. Although it would be best for you to avoid the Bannor lands. You are not a heretic, but you did strike your commanding officer."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Uncompromising even as the fate of the world hangs in the balance?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"How else do you think we survived this long, my son? I am glad to see you in a good place. But do not expect us to change, not so fast. Perhaps as we work with your Overcouncil, we can test these new ideas that Varn Gosam is teaching. Well. We must report back, and lady Capria will be pleased to hear that you are here supporting us. Be well."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And you," Decius replied, before turning back to his army.

Malakim warriors, dressed for the arctic battle in lion fur coats, descended upon the Doviello. The wild men turn on them in a rage, but the newcomers to the Aquillo tundra hold their lines, showing a discipline matching the Bannor's. The Bannor commander ordered his hunters to strike, and the Doviello ambush is turned to a rout, with Malakim cavalry chasing down the survivors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Commander Samatheon Achare stepped forward to offer thanks to their saviors, but stopped when he saw who stepped out to greet him. "I see the Bannor sent their best to stop the end of the world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Decius? By Junil, I had feared you dead."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. I am not dead. I have traveled the ends of the earth to seek refuge from false accusations, but I live and am better for it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"False accusations. Not false, for I accused you in good faith, but wrong nonetheless. Arret, Rosier's uncle, was revealed a necromancer in the sacking of Torrolerial. But the evidence before my eyes could not be ignored. A man cannot show favoritism to his own kin over the rule of law-that is the way of anarchy and tyranny. I have long grieved for what transpired between us-that you would see your own father as your persecutor, that the promise your life showed should be wasted."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I understand. I cannot say I regret my flee from justice, but I absolve you. The Bannor notion of righteousness is lacking-incomplete. But you served me well in my youth, and gave me a love of goodness and honor that I was able to preserve, despite everything. My time with the Malakim, these men who now follow me, allowed me to grasp the complete vision-justice paired with redemption and reconciliation. It will be good to speak of these matters further with you, should we survive this war with Auric."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes. Although it would be best for you to avoid the Bannor lands. You are not a heretic, but you did strike your commanding officer."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Uncompromising even as the fate of the world hangs in the balance?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"How else do you think we survived this long, my son? I am glad to see you in a good place. But do not expect us to change, not so fast. Perhaps as we work with your Overcouncil, we can test these new ideas that Varn Gosam is teaching. Well. We must report back, and lady Capria will be pleased to hear that you are here supporting us. Be well."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And you," Decius replied, before turning back to his army.

TEXT.English: You have tamed the spirit that ruled me; though you bring me death I thank you for it.
TEXT.French: You have tamed the spirit that ruled me; though you bring me death I thank you for it.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt den Geist bezähmt, der mich beherrscht hat. Obwohl Ihr mir den Tod bringt, danke ich Euch dafür.
TEXT.Italian: You have tamed the spirit that ruled me; though you bring me death I thank you for it.
TEXT.Spanish: You have tamed the spirit that ruled me; though you bring me death I thank you for it.

TEXT.English: In life or death I only wait for Auric's rebirth as the God of Winter. You cannot change that.
TEXT.French: In life or death I only wait for Auric's rebirth as the God of Winter. You cannot change that.
TEXT.German: Egal ob lebendig oder tot, ich warte nur auf Aurics Geburt als Gott des Winters. Das könnt Ihr nicht verhindern.
TEXT.Italian: In life or death I only wait for Auric's rebirth as the God of Winter. You cannot change that.
TEXT.Spanish: In life or death I only wait for Auric's rebirth as the God of Winter. You cannot change that.

TEXT.English: The Bannor will stand until the end, but we have reached that point.
TEXT.French: The Bannor will stand until the end, but we have reached that point.
TEXT.German: Die Bannor werden bis zum Ende ausharren, doch dieser Punkt ist nun erreicht.
TEXT.Italian: The Bannor will stand until the end, but we have reached that point.
TEXT.Spanish: The Bannor will stand until the end, but we have reached that point.

TEXT.English: Let my army fall, I'll raise another from the pits of Prespur.
TEXT.French: Let my army fall, I'll raise another from the pits of Prespur.
TEXT.German: Lasst meine Armee untergehen. Ich werden eine andere in den Gruben von Prespur ausheben.
TEXT.Italian: Let my army fall, I'll raise another from the pits of Prespur.
TEXT.Spanish: Let my army fall, I'll raise another from the pits of Prespur.

TEXT.English: We are entering the night; the Malakim have fallen.
TEXT.French: We are entering the night; the Malakim have fallen.
TEXT.German: Wir gehen ins Dunkel. Die Malakim sind besiegt.
TEXT.Italian: We are entering the night; the Malakim have fallen.
TEXT.Spanish: We are entering the night; the Malakim have fallen.

TEXT.English: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.
TEXT.French: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.
TEXT.German: Der Weiße Drache harrt Eurer. Ich bin nur traurig, dass ich nicht sehen werde, wie er Euch heimsucht.
TEXT.Italian: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.
TEXT.Spanish: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.

TEXT.English: He is too strong, I cannot go on my friend.
TEXT.French: He is too strong, I cannot go on my friend.
TEXT.German: Er ist zu stark. Ich kann Euch nicht weiter begleiten, mein Freund.
TEXT.Italian: He is too strong, I cannot go on my friend.
TEXT.Spanish: He is too strong, I cannot go on my friend.

TEXT.English: The Doviello are done, there is no place for them in this age.
TEXT.French: The Doviello are done, there is no place for them in this age.
TEXT.German: Die Doviello sind besiegt. Für sie gibt es in diesem Zeitalter keinen Platz mehr.
TEXT.Italian: The Doviello are done, there is no place for them in this age.
TEXT.Spanish: The Doviello are done, there is no place for them in this age.

TEXT.English: Are all the Hippus to fall to one man? You must avenge Tasunke without me.
TEXT.French: Are all the Hippus to fall to one man? You must avenge Tasunke without me.
TEXT.German: Werden alle Hippus einem Mann zum Opfer fallen? Ihr müsst Tasunke ohne mich rächen.
TEXT.Italian: Are all the Hippus to fall to one man? You must avenge Tasunke without me.
TEXT.Spanish: Are all the Hippus to fall to one man? You must avenge Tasunke without me.

TEXT.English: Rage against me as you will, the winter will not end.
TEXT.French: Rage against me as you will, the winter will not end.
TEXT.German: Wettere gegen mich solange du willst. Der Winter wird nicht enden.
TEXT.Italian: Rage against me as you will, the winter will not end.
TEXT.Spanish: Rage against me as you will, the winter will not end.

TEXT.English: The summer queen enslaved me. This was never the path I wanted.
TEXT.French: The summer queen enslaved me. This was never the path I wanted.
TEXT.German: Die Sommerkönigin hat mich versklavt. Dies war niemals der Weg, den ich gehen wollte.
TEXT.Italian: The summer queen enslaved me. This was never the path I wanted.
TEXT.Spanish: The summer queen enslaved me. This was never the path I wanted.

TEXT.English: Description: Auric means to ascend to godhood. If Erebus is to be saved from another Age of Ice you must stop him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: You will be placed in control of the weakest member of your team. You must coordinate your unit's forces together, because if any member falls you will likely be in control of them when they do.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Completion of The Black Tower, The Cult, and Against the Grey.

Ihr müsst die Kräfte eurer Einheiten zusammen koordinieren, denn, falls einer der Verbündeten untergeht, werdet Ihr wahrscheinlich gerade dessen Führung inne haben.

TEXT.English: Across the Aquilo Tundra leaders sat in war rooms staring at scattered maps on long tables. Rhoanna was determined and anxious, pushing her captains to make immediate attacks against the Doviello and the Illians before they prepare their defenses. Capria, always aware of the threat of overextension, advised her captains to carefully guard their foothold on Auric's island and expand slowly. Falamar landed offshore from the tundra so that he could train units and launch attacks without fear of direct retaliation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Their enemies were no different. Riuros, Anagantios and Dumannios had little concern for the meager boats that landed on their shores, but Lucian took the invasion more seriously and he was glad to see Mahala arrive with more soldiers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have done well." Mahala said, "News of your victories has drawn many Doviello from the wastes looking for blood, or to be nearby when Auric's rewards are handed out."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She paused, looking through one of her supply chests for a belt of short knives, before asking, "Is it true that Cassiel is dead?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes. Midgar burned to the ground and their king was sacrificed in one of Auric's rituals."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If the stories are true then you and the Illian commanders are the first to witness the death of an archangel. What was it like?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lucian shifted uncomfortably, "He died poorly, chained like a dog and serving his enemies' purpose in his death instead of his own."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Let us hope that we fare better than he did." Mahala said half-joking, but Lucian remained quiet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I have been to Auric's capital." Mahala said, switching the subject, "I have seen the pillar of light from his ritual, felt the welling power of a god soon to be born, and watched the dragon circling the city. It is hard to imagine that Auric will not succeed, and if he does we are best to be on his side when he does. Are these your thoughts as well?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lucian considered. He was a powerful man among the Doviello, strong, clever and brutal. Although very capable, there were thousands of men like him across Erebus. Those born among the Lanun became pirates living on the edges of their society, their lawlessness made them feared by victims and fellow pirates alike, and outcasts from their own society. Among the Bannor men like him were quickly imprisoned or sent to the gallows. Success isn't a result of talent alone, but of your talents value in your society. One society's general is another's criminal, one society's artist is another's madman.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes." Lucian answered, "The Doviello cannot live in this world, we must return to an older one if we are to flourish."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Very well, we have only to scatter these fledgling armies until Auric completes his ritual. Then we will return to our more primal world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar never imagined himself as a commander of anything but his own ship. For him supply lines were something to be intercepted and pilfered, not guarded. A treasury should finance nights of excess, not a growing war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We have delivered Rhoanna to the war." Amergin offered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was as close as loyal Amergin ever came to questioning his captain, the implication that they had earned some rest after their defeat of Tebryn in the Dead Lands.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, I suppose we have. But if she defeats Auric, what sort of victory will it be, and how can we miss the opportunity to participate in such legends." Falamar answered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We have gone from hunting wolves to demonic armies, played parts in the Momus's crazed game and watched our brothers reborn as undead before our eyes. These may be legends, but there is little glory in them."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar nodded. "And if she fails, what then? What sort of world will it be? Can even the Black Wind sail fast enough to escape the grip of eternal winter, or will we all share Malus's fate?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No." Amergin answered, "The Lanun could not survive in that world, we must save this one."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Amergin paused before adding, "Forgive my ramblings, I am ever at your side. I have been away from my rum for too long, and it muddies my thoughts."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar smiled, placing two cups on the table and pulling a small cast from beneath it. He poured them both drinks as he smiled adding, "Or perhaps your time sober has made your thoughts too clear, that is never a good trait for a soldier."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They laughed, toasted and drank into the night, sharing stories and planning for the hard days ahead.

TEXT.English: The Illian capital is a ring of military buildings around a massive pillar of pale white light. An intense cold radiates out from the light, frosting exposed flesh and reaching through the thickest furs to chill bones and freeze the breath. The Illian defenders are quickly cut down, they refuse to retreat into the pillar, seeming more afraid of what lies within it than the advancing army.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The capture of the city doesn't stop the ritual. Everyone can feel the welling power, the proximity to a powerful, divine, malevolent force. A few archers lob arrows into the pillar without effect, fire spells dissipate uselessly.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius sticks the Nether Blade through the veil of light, when he withdraws it is cold to the touch by undamaged. He sheaths the sword and goes back to where the commanders discuss a plan. With no good options Rhoanna breaks the stalemate. In one quick motion she pulls the Nether Blade from Decius's belt and charges into the light.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Stepping into the pillar is like entering a new world. Primal winds howl and the light is replaced with the white of a raging blizzard. Everything is white, and what was the flat ground of the city center is replaced with a steep mountainous slope.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna crawls forward, she can feel the cold air tearing through her, like she has swallowed knives. Through the sleet of white she gets occasional glimpses of a steep mountainside behind her, and beyond a vast black swamp. Other howls give evidence that she isn't alone on the slope but she keeps climbing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Her arms and legs go past cold, go past numb and start feeling warm. She is only sure she still drags the Nether Blade along with her because she can see it in her hand. Dreams begin to overcome her, the soft grasslands of her home, the feel of a saddle beneath her, the warmth of Falamar's bed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She stops moving, seeing another world around her as a frost giant lumbers out of the storm. Unwilling to smash such a nice meal he picks up the freezing Rhoanna in one giant fist. She curls up in his hand, then in a flash of clarity realizes where she is and stabs out with the sword, piercing his neck and sending the giant falling backwards. He is dead before he hits the ground. Determined, Rhoanna pulls the sword out of his neck and once again begins her ascent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It is only a few hundred feet, but it feels like miles. By the time she can see the peak her arms and legs refuse to obey her. But she can see Auric standing on the peak unaffected by the raging blizzard around him. Around him, around the mountain itself, a god rages.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric looks at the woman staggering towards him. He is transcendent, a man at his most powerful, almost a god against a woman who is too stubborn to die. He smiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For Tasunke she thinks, she tries to scream it but she can't muster the breath to force the words through frozen lips. She promises her body, one last rush and she will allow it to die, just another 20 feet. She staggers closer as Auric raises a hand and says, "Slow..."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Everything stops, her heartbeats stretch out weak and thin, even falling to her knees takes seconds and that last breath out of her body goes on for much longer. Her hair whips around her head at a slower rate than the wind and she simply stares at it in confusion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then blue eyes command her attention. Falamar places his hands over hers, tightening her grip on the sword. She can see the pain and cold in his eyes, the strain of pushing your body past its limits, the knowledge that you are already dead but still pressing on. But still he smiles and pulls her up onto her feet with the Nether Blade between them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auric looks irritated, as Rhoanna and Falamar charge forward he simply says, "Snowfall".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A wall of snow so thick even Auric is blinded by it explodes out of him, but it does not stop them. Pushing through wall of ice the sword holds and they both jam it deeply into Auric's chest. For a second there is no sound on the mountaintop as Auric stands confused. Then he screams, a scream that is echoed by the spirit of the god above him and thousands of frost spirits that hunt the mountain. Then it is all gone.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the Illian capital the light recedes into the bone colored sky leaving Rhoanna and Falamar lying alone in the center. Hippus and Lanun commanders rush in, calling for priests.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Don't think this gets you out of owing me a ship." Rhoanna quips as priests tended to both of them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I keep telling you, that was my brother-in-law." Falamar responds.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Night falls on combined armies, but no one sleeps. They are beyond tired, but still talk, laugh and celebrate on the tundra. And even a few of the Bannor soldiers relax and tell a few jokes, a sure sign that it must be a new age on Erebus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]-- Epilogue --[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne played beneath the Tulip Poplar tree. She could see the palace through a veil of fog and hear the distant sounds of the city beyond the palace grounds. Somewhere within the gardens other child ran and played, but she could not see them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This place, this dream, wrapped itself tightly around her. It was easy to believe. But nagging thoughts, the trials and pains of her life, would not let her rest. She was not a child, she was the ruler of an empire she loved, she had taken that empire to war, seen countless good soldiers die and she had been the victim of an assassin's attack.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was this last thought that jarred her from the dream. That attack, the dark blade that stole her life and carried her soul to this place. She could see it clearly now, she was a child no more.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The shape of a palace obscured by fog remained, as did the spirits of children playing in the field. The Tulip Poplar tree was gone, until she looked for it, and then it reappeared. She wore a beautiful mourning gown, which is traditional for burial among the Elohim, but Ethne suspected it wasn't real either.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As Ethne walked she found other spirits trapped within their own dreams, playing, sleeping or talking quietly to empty air. They seemed peaceful enough so she didn't disturb them. There was no wall around the palace grounds as she had imagined, and no city beyond, only the hazy surface of this world and a labyrinth of passages to chambers full of other dreams.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was impossible to tell how long she walked. Some places were pleasant, a field of flowers and wild birds, a pond where a boy and a large yellow dog played together, a mother who eternally sung to her child. Others were darker, a shadowy forest inhabited by glowing moths, a cellar where Ethne heard crying but couldn't find anyone, a lost child calling eternally for help. And some of the chambers were just strange, there was a city that ran backwards, an empty carnival where spirits ran and hid from each other and a galleon coming straight out of the ground crewed by souls ever looking unsuccessfully for land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eventually Ethne wandered onto a small farm. A single barn stood on a field that had been recently harvested, the barn itself was well stocked with grain and the smell of freshly cut wheat filled the air. A man sat on a chair in front of the barn looking at a distant village, barely visible beyond the haze.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The man looked at Ethne as she approached.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"None of it is real." He said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I know," Ethne replied startled, "did you grow up on this farm?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, on a farm like this."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Shackles snaked up through the ground and clasped onto the man wrists. Ethne turned to run but another pair grabbed her. They were both pulled through the surface of the ground, into a world without light, substance or breath. When they came out they were dropped into a summoning circle in a large vaulted ivory chamber. A man with a crown of mirrors and deep black pits instead of eyes stared at both of them. A blue skinned angel stood beside him and around the room hundreds of humans, elves, dwarves and orcs stood watching. Ethne knew they were all great people from many ages, kings and heroes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ethne. Auric." The man without eyes said, "Welcome to my palace. There are only two choices in the world of the dead, you wait endlessly, or you rebel. I am the leader of that rebellion, I am Laroth."

TEXT.English: The Kuriotates loyalty is admirable, but it has made them soft. You wonder how such a compliant people could present a threat to the Doviello. But their vaults show the benefit of their accumulation, you capture 250 gold from their treasury.
TEXT.French: The Kuriotates loyalty is admirable, but it has made them soft. You wonder how such a compliant people could present a threat to the Doviello. But their vaults show the benefit of their accumulation, you capture 250 gold from their treasury.
TEXT.German: Die Loyalität der Kuriotate ist bewundernswert, aber sie hat sie auch weich gemacht. Ihr fragt Euch, wie solch ein nachgiebiges Volk jemals eine Gefahr für die Doviello darstellen konnte. Aber ihre Schatzkammern zeigen die Vorzüge ihrer Haltung, als Ihr 250 Gold ihres Staatsschatzes findet.

TEXT.English: Description: Mahala has commanded you to aide the Illians. If they are to survive you must destroy the armies that are arrayed against them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: If the Illians are destroyed you lose.
TEXT.French: Description: Mahala has commanded you to aide the Illians. If they are to survive you must destroy the armies that are arrayed against them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: If the Illians are destroyed you lose.
TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Mahala hat Euch befohlen, den Illianern zu helfen. Wenn sie überleben sollen, müsst Ihr die Armeen vernichten, die sich ihnen entgegenstellen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Falls die Illianer ausgelöscht werden, ist die Partie verloren.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Belohnung: Der erfolgreiche Abschluss dieses Szenarios gewährt Zugang zum Szenario "Blut der Engel".

TEXT.English: Protect the Illians by defeating all the other civilizations!
TEXT.French: Protect the Illians by defeating all the other civilizations!
TEXT.German: Schütze die Illianer indem du alle anderen Nationen vernichtest
TEXT.Italian: Protect the Illians by defeating all the other civilizations!
TEXT.Spanish: Protect the Illians by defeating all the other civilizations!

TEXT.English: The Age of Rebirth has begun and new empires are forming across Erebus. As the snow retreats so does the power of the Doviello. Our people turn on each other for our meager resources or abandon us entirely. Within a few generations most believe we will be gone, the starving pet of a defeated god.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But our prophets say that there is hope. A man born among the Illians is the resurrected form of Mulcarn and can ascend into the role of the god of winter. Some refuse to listen, but there is no alternative if we are to survive. You gather your tribe, to deliver this message and your allegiance to the Illians but you arrive to find them under attack. The "goodly" empires have banded together to wipe them out, if the man in the prophecy is to survive you must save the Illians from the attack.

You gather your tribe, to deliver this message and your allegiance to the Illians but you arrive to find them under attack. The "goodly" empires have banded together to wipe them out, if the man in the prophecy is to survive you must save the Illians from the attack.
TEXT.German: Das Zeitalter der Wiedergeburt hat begonnen und neue Reiche enstehen überall auf Erebus. Mit dem Rückzug des Eises geht auch die Macht der Doviello zu Ende. Unsere Leute kämpfen untereinander um unsere mageren Ressourcen oder verlassen unser Volk gleich ganz. Viele glauben, dass wir innerhalb weniger Generationen verschwunden sein werden, das verhungernde Schoßtier eines besiegten Gottes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Aber unsere Propheten sagen, dass es noch Hoffnung gibt. Ein Mann, ein gebürtiger Illian, trägt den wiederauferstandenen Mulcarn in sich und kann zum Gott des Winters aufsteigen. Einige weigern sich zuzuhören, aber es gibt keine Alternative, wenn wir überleben wollen. Ihr versammelt Euren Stamm, um diese Nachricht zu überbringen und den Illian Eure Gefolgschaft zu schwören, aber als Ihr ankommt, werden sie bereits angegriffen. Die "guten" Reiche haben sich zusammengeschlossen, um die Illian auszurotten. Wenn der Mann aus der Prophezeiung überleben soll, müsst Ihr den Illian in dieser Schlacht beistehen und den Angriff zurückschlagen.

TEXT.English: Outside of the defenders the Grigori capital is abandoned. Your men do discover two priests that had been held in the Grigori dungeon. They send the priests to your capital, where they pledge their loyalty to you.
TEXT.French: Outside of the defenders the Grigori capital is abandoned. Your men do discover two priests that had been held in the Grigori dungeon. They send the priests to your capital, where they pledge their loyalty to you.
TEXT.German: Außer den Verteidigern befindet sich niemand in der Hauptstadt der Grigori. Allerdings finden Eure Männer doch noch 2 Priester, die im Verlies der Grigori gefangen gehalten wurden. Die Priester werden in Eure Hauptstadt geschickt, wo sie Euch Treue schwören.

TEXT.English: Runners have already escaped to warn the Bannor empire of their loss. But Tethira stands defiantly with the last of the city's defenders within his palace. They offer satisfying screams as you light the building on fire. Your military victory inspires your troops, increasing their experience.

TEXT.German: Während Eure Armee die bannorische Hauptstadt einnimmt, ist Capria längst geflohen. Ihr letztes Aufgebot verschanzt sich im Palast und gibt befriedigende Schreie von sich, als Ihr das Gebäude anzündet. Euer militärischer Sieg beflügelt Eure Truppen und steigert ihre Erfahrung.

TEXT.English: The Illians' homeland has been reclaimed. The Illian elders are grateful for your help and they listen intently to your story of the prophecy. Together you set out to the site of Mulcarns death, the ruins of Letum Frigus. You arrive just as Illian man walks out of the ruins. He is barely covered but unaffected by the freezing temperature.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am the one you seek, Auric Ulvin, the reborn form of the god of winter. Follow me and this world will belong to us again."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Around you men drop to their knees in worship, Doviello and Illian alike. Could this young man be the god you seek?

Follow me and this world will belong to us again."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Around you men drop to their knees in worship, Doviello and Illian alike. Could this young man be the god you seek?
TEXT.German: Die Heimat der Illian wurde zurückgewonnen. Die Weisen der Illian sind für Eure Hilfe dankbar und hören Eurer Geschichte und der Prophezeiung aufmerksam zu. Gemeinsam mit ihnen begebt Ihr Euch zu der Stätte von Mulcarns Tod, den Ruinen von Letum Frigus. Als Ihr ankommt, verlässt ein Mann gerade die Ruinen. Er hat nur Fetzen am Leib, aber offenbar spürt er die eisigen Temperaturen nicht.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich bin jener, welchen ihr sucht, Auric Ulvin, der wiedergeborene Gott des Winters. Folgt mir und diese Welt wird wieder uns gehören."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Um Euch herum fallen Männer in Ehrfurcht auf ihre Knie, Doviello und Illian gleichermaßen. Könnte dieser Mann der Gott sein, den Ihr sucht?

TEXT.English: Description: Tebryn means to destroy the world. He has gathered his generals around him and has bent the power of the Dead Lands to his control. If Armageddon is to be prevented Tebryn must be stopped here.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Special Rules: Human units won't heal in this scenario. Human units that die are reborn as demonic units under Tebryn's control. Tebryn's lands can't be entered until all the other Sheaim players are defeated.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires: Successful completion of the Radiant Guard scenario.

TEXT.German: Beschreibung: Tebryn hat vor, die Welt zu zerstören. Er hat seine Gneräle um sich versammelt und die Macht des Totenreichs unter seine Kontrolle gebracht. Wenn Armageddon verhindert werden soll, muss Tebryn hier aufgehalten werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Besondere Regeln: Menschliche Einheiten können in diesem Szenario nicht geheilt werden. Menschliche Einheiten, die getötet werden, werden als Dämonen-Einheit unter Tebryns Kontrolle wiedergeboren. Tebryns Reich kann nicht betreten werden, bis nicht alle anderen sheaïmischen Oberhäupter besiegt sind.

TEXT.English: Rhoanna lay tangled in the sheets. She was as beautiful and fierce as any woman, and a lifetime spent in the saddle had turned last night's passion into an athletic event. Falamar had always felt himself a more than adequate, some had said legendary, lover but Rhoanna was insatiable. Falamar slipped quietly from the bed in the fear that if she awoke she would not let him escape. He felt sudden sympathy for the wild mustangs Rhoanna had ridden until they broke and surrendered to her will.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Up on deck the sea air revived him and he stretched and called for a report from Amergin, and a hot tea from a deck hand.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No rum captain?" the deck hand asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My body aches enough this morning Rory, best to at least keep my mind sharp." Falamar answered, then turning to Amergin he said, "How close are we to the Dead Lands?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We will be upon them by midday. There are already reports that the Sheaim are readying for us, and our advance ship returned during the night crewed by skeletons. We had to sink it ourselves."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar's eyes widened and he called down to Rory in the mess, "on second thought I'll take a bit of rum with that, on the side." Looking back at Amergin he asked, "Anything else?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Dead Lands appear much as our own except at its heart where it's as defiled as Hyborems own lands. Tebryn has a spell around these lands that keeps anyone from entering without his approval. This spell is maintained by ritualists in the capital of his generals, Averax, Gosea and Malchavic. Until they are destroyed we won't be able to assault Tebryn directly."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rory placed the hot tea and rum at Falamar's side and asked, "Anything else captain?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No, thank you Rory." Falamar quickly drank the rum before asking Amergin to continue.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There are reports that men who die within this region find their souls drawn to the black tower, where they are transformed into hellish versions of themselves, skeletons, wraiths, sect of flies, eidolons and such. I cannot imagine a worse fate for a man's soul, and for us it means that we will face any we lose in battle."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm going to need more rum!" Falamar yelled to Rory, who quickly scrambled to refill Falamars goblet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Anything else Amergin?" Falamar asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The living seem unable to heal here. Those injured in the battle against the skeleton ship still bleed as if their wounds were fresh. These lands are cursed, and it does not favor us."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar downed the second rum, "And what of the rum?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We are well stocked captain."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Lock away my enemy in an unassailable location, subject me to the threat of eternal damnation as some wretched bone pile, remove from me even the tiny gifts of health and healing, but leave the rum."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Aye captain." Amergin grinned, a rare sight on the first mate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You had best rouse our guest and tell her everything you have told me. We will need all the strength we have by midday."

He felt sudden sympathy for the wild mustangs Rhoanna had ridden until they broke and surrendered to her will.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Up on deck the sea air revived him and he stretched and called for a report from Amergin, and a hot tea from a deck hand.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No rum captain?" the deck hand asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"My body aches enough this morning Rory, best to at least keep my mind sharp." Falamar answered, then turning to Amergin he said, "How close are we to the Dead Lands?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We will be upon them by midday. There are already reports that the Sheaim are readying for us, and our advance ship returned during the night crewed by skeletons. We had to sink it ourselves."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar's eyes widened and he called down to Rory in the mess, "on second thought I'll take a bit of rum with that, on the side." Looking back at Amergin he asked, "Anything else?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Dead Lands appear much as our own except at its heart where it's as defiled as Hyborems own lands. Tebryn has a spell around these lands that keeps anyone from entering without his approval. This spell is maintained by ritualists in the capital of his generals, Averax, Gosea and Malchavic. Until they are destroyed we won't be able to assault Tebryn directly."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rory placed the hot tea and rum at Falamar's side and asked, "Anything else captain?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No, thank you Rory." Falamar quickly drank the rum before asking Amergin to continue.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"There are reports that men who die within this region find their souls drawn to the black tower, where they are transformed into hellish versions of themselves, skeletons, wraiths, sect of flies, eidolons and such. I cannot imagine a worse fate for a man's soul, and for us it means that we will face any we lose in battle."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm going to need more rum!" Falamar yelled to Rory, who quickly scrambled to refill Falamars goblet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Anything else Amergin?" Falamar asked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The living seem unable to heal here. Those injured in the battle against the skeleton ship still bleed as if their wounds were fresh. These lands are cursed, and it does not favor us."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar downed the second rum, "And what of the rum?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We are well stocked captain."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Lock away my enemy in an unassailable location, subject me to the threat of eternal damnation as some wretched bone pile, remove from me even the tiny gifts of health and healing, but leave the rum."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Aye captain." Amergin grinned, a rare sight on the first mate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You had best rouse our guest and tell her everything you have told me. We will need all the strength we have by midday."

TEXT.English: There was a celebration that would make Perpentach himself jealous. When Tebryn died the black tower collapsed around him. Many wondered if he survived the attack until they noticed that the corruption of the land began to heal, as did the injured men. Everywhere men of various nations drank, sung and for the first time in months, relaxed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar grabbed a bottle of rare Svartalfar wine and went to find Rhoanna. The war kept them both so busy that he hadn't seen her for weeks, and he found himself almost as excited to see her as he was to defeat the Sheaim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He found her in a small group of her captains along with a Hippus messenger that Falamar didn't recognize. Expecting cheers from the group Falamar stopped when he noticed they spoke in hushed somber tones, even while the rest of the army celebrated around them. Even Rhoanna's dark eyes were swollen and red; she had been crying. But there were no tears now, only anger and determination.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Is everything alright?" Falamar asked. He set the wine down as it felt inappropriate to stand there dumbly holding it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The captains quieted, they saluted Falamar but didn't answer the question. Rhoanna gave Falamar a weary smile, she was happy to see him and felt somehow relieved to have him close despite the recent news.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Tasunke is the head of the Aroul-Hippi, the most powerful Hippus clan. He is, he was, as close as we have to a king."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]She paused here. Falamar knew who Tasunke was, she had spoken frequently of him with both frustration and admiration. But even outside of Rhoanna's tales there weren't many in Erebus who hadn't heard of the mercenary king of the Hippus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The Illians are rising in the north." Rhoanna continued, "and they had hired Tasunke to fight for them. When they were finished with him, they killed him and turned on the Aroul-Hippi. There are a fragile few that were able to escape the purge. Altheriol-ta-Mealthiel is gone, our people are slaughtered and the only armies that remain are those that fought here."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar sat down beside Rhoanna. The captains' faces were stern but it was obvious they had been arguing the next steps. Despite their great respect for Falamar, they considered this a Hippus matter and weren't willing to involve him unless Rhoanna did. But Falamar could guess the points of the argument, some of them wanted to seek revenge and attack the Illians and others wanted to withdrawal into lands that were safe and rebuild.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The fate of the Hippus and Lanun are intertwined. You have our strength and friendship if you desire it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Even if we sail against the Illians?" Rhoanna asked, "We have reports that their leader means to resurrect the god of winter and cast us into eternal winter. They prepare now for the ritual. Would you be so quick to jump from the fires of the Sheaim into the freezing winds of the Illians?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Falamar thought about it. He hadn't expected another war, and knew his men had more than earned their rest. They would be remembered for generations for what they had accomplished here. How could he ask them to exchange that for another desperate war?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rhoanna knew he would join her when she saw his crooked smile.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That depends," Falamar asked, "would we get to share a flagship again?"
