TEXT.English: Decius attended the meeting of the Undercouncil in person. The current Calabim emissary, a corpulent vampire lord, glared at him from his seat when Decius entered. It mattered little to Decius-most of the vampiric aristocrats were angry with him for upsetting their hierarchy. He had the Brujahs on his side, though, for if he had his way they would have ample opportunity to prove their worth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius skipped the formalities of the meeting, waiting only for the Svartalfar Speaker's invocation of Esus over the meeting before speaking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Our spies tell me that Varn Gosam traveled west with much of his army long before our assault on the Empyrean shrine. Specifically, to aid the Elohim against your armies and those of Hyborem. If the Malakim reinforce the Elohim to the east, they may hold out against your pet, and perhaps even save the Ljosalfar."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Faeryl Viconia will subdue our renegade cousins in the Umbrawood. Their fate is none of your concern."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And we care little of the ultimate fate of the Elohim. They have already brought in the Mercurians to aid them-this battle will inevitably engulf the world, bringing ruin. Your involvement is now irrelevant."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius shook his head. "Bravado. Should the Calabim stay out of the Tempus Mor region and consolidate our position, it is quite likely that your Infernal allies will be stopped before they can establish themselves-and then the Ashen Veil will be destroyed, along with all the plots of the Sheaim. Varn Gosam may be willing to stop with that, but if the Order becomes involved-and they will, believe me-they will then turn on the Svartalfar, burning your forests to the ground if they must. No, clearly you have bitten off more than you can chew."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Svartalfar Councilor smiled at Decius with murderous intent, but the Sheaim emissary replied, "Your words have merit. What do you want from us? Surely the spoils of this conflict will be enough to satisfy the needs of the Calabim? The blood of men and elves... this is what you crave, is it not?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"That would be enough to satisfy Flauros and Alexis. I want more. I want an empire. Everything from the taiga bordering the Umbra down the coast of the great Ocean to the Deruptus mountains, and west to the foothills of Tempus Mor."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Hmph. Is that all? The Svartalfar have no cares for the human lands."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Very well, Decius, we can come to an agreement. Your assistance here, and you shall be granted all the lands to the east-provided our Ritualists are granted access to the cities of the Calabim."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius nodded, then turned to go. Should this battle result in victory, his empire would rival that of even the Bannor.

TEXT.Spanish: Decius attended the meeting of the Undercouncil in person. The current Calabim emissary, a corpulent vampire lord, glared at him from his seat when Decius entered. It mattered little to Decius-most of the vampiric aristocrats were angry with him for upsetting their hierarchy. He had the Brujahs on his side, though, for if he had his way they would have ample opportunity to prove their worth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius skipped the formalities of the meeting, waiting only for the Svartalfar Speaker's invocation of Esus over the meeting before speaking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Our spies tell me that Varn Gosam traveled west with much of his army long before our assault on the Empyrean shrine. Specifically, to aid the Elohim against your armies and those of Hyborem. If the Malakim reinforce the Elohim to the east, they may hold out against your pet, and perhaps even save the Ljosalfar."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Faeryl Viconia will subdue our renegade cousins in the Umbrawood. Their fate is none of your concern."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And we care little of the ultimate fate of the Elohim. They have already brought in the Mercurians to aid them-this battle will inevitably engulf the world, bringing ruin. Your involvement is now irrelevant."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius shook his head. "Bravado. Should the Calabim stay out of the Tempus Mor region and consolidate our position, it is quite likely that your Infernal allies will be stopped before they can establish themselves-and then the Ashen Veil will be destroyed, along with all the plots of the Sheaim. Varn Gosam may be willing to stop with that, but if the Order becomes involved-and they will, believe me-they will then turn on the Svartalfar, burning your forests to the ground if they must. TEXT.English: He found her in the infirmary. There were many among them who were skilled in healing arts; the Elohim temples and medical colleges were the most advanced in the world. So Ethne was not tending to the wounded directly, but rather to those so caught up in their work that they neglected themselves. She brought food to healers who were caring for the diseased, blankets for monks who had passed out exhausted among the burned or catatonic, and wiped away tears from priestesses caring for the maimed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As his shadow fell over her, Ethne turned and rose to face Einion. "Did you think you could deceive me?" he asked her.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne bowed her head. "Deception is not a skill I posses, dear Logos. I merely neglected to consult about this course of action. Please do not take it as a sign of disrespect."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Einion tapped his staff sharply on the ground, making an echo through the stone hall. "You are too coy child. I had to find out from Valoel, after he had already begun construction. Surely some madness has gripped you!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Have you another plan? If so, I have not heard it. Os-Gabella has refused our ambassadors, and the Infernal reception was far worse. The Winter Queen has promised to bring peace to the forests, even as the people of Evermore are sold as slaves."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The lands that we have lost are unimportant. We can have the peace to continue our mission of preservation if we realize what is important. In these times of war, it is all the more important that we seek to save the knowledge that has been gained since the dawn of the Age. We have no need of these barbaric 'heavenly' warriors! As it was written in the times of our ancestors, 'Let virtue be your spear and faith your shield.'"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne turned her gaze around the room filled with burned pilgrims and their maimed defenders. "Which of these lacked virtue, then, and which lacked faith?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Einion was silent a moment, but not long enough for Ethne to think she swayed him. "A great many more will be so afflicted, and due to your actions our hands will be awash in the blood of the next victims. What you do here you do without my blessing. Oh great Sirona, why have I lived so long to see us come to this?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne bowed her head respectfully as Einion retreated, then said softly, "If you live any longer, honored friend, it will be due to the warriors of heaven you so deplore."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The gate was built. It was everything Einion feared and everything Ethne prayed.

TEXT.English: Decius watched the armies of the allied Malakim tribes array into a rough formation, each man with his arms and near his kin. There was much squabbling and joking; far from the ordered troops he had commanded on Bannor crusade. "They are not prepared for what we face, Vaughn."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We haven't embarked on a religious war before. We have no hardened crusaders among us. I count this a point in favor of the Empyrean, do you not?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I do not count naïveté as a virtue when I march to war. Fanaticism is a vice I do not wish to import, but martial discipline will be critical if any of these men are to return."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Vicar frowned. "It would be good if we could stay longer in this desert, where we have the advantage. But if our council is to sustain us in our hard times, we must stand with the Elohim in their dark hour."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Indeed. I would prefer to train them more, but what Varn Gosam tells me is cause for immediate mobilization. There is a dark and secretive people known as the Sheaim, and their schemes have reached fruition with an Infernal Pact. Agaress archangel Hyborem has entered our world. He has struck against the Ljosalfar, allowing our old enemies the Svartalfar an advantage in their war. The Elohim have brought in another ally, a force for good but not for peace-the renegade Basium and his warriors. Weakness in this war will bring destruction to the forces of good."

TEXT.English: Abnoba oversaw the chanting of the ritualists. Not a word was misspoke. They had had the importance of this ritual made extremely clear. He turned to his queen, seated in her throne gazing impassively at the magic circle in the dim candle light.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I cannot say that this will grant you what you seek, milady."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No, likely it will not. Hyborem's powers are great indeed, but even he lacks the power to rescind a blessing given by the twenty-one in concert. It seems I am destined to see the end of this world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If anything would bring the apocalypse upon our world, it would be this ritual. Agares's followers will be bound to this world..." She trailed off as a sudden shaking almost knocked her to her feet. "Milady! Are we besieged?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Abnoba... foolish child, what did you expect the rearrangement of the universe to feel like? Although doubtless the Bannor camp at our borders would take this as provocation and besiege us, and it would be to our advantage to let them face the Infernals and rip this land asunder... our spies tell us that they shall soon have to return home and face a worse surprise in the halls of Torrolerial. So we must find some other target for our new patron Hyborem."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Ashen Veil priestess smiled. "The north."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Os-Gabella beckoned. From the shadows came a Succubus. "If Hyborem has done his part from Hell, his forces should be emerging near Tempus Mor. The civil war of the Elven states should distract them enough for Hyborem to gain ground." The Succubus nodded and left the hall.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And we?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Os-Gabella smiled. "As we have ever done. Bring discord and strife until this world is unfit for the great experiment it was built for."

It seems I am destined to see the end of this world."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If anything would bring the apocalypse upon our world, it would be this ritual. Agares's followers will be bound to this world..." She trailed off as a sudden shaking almost knocked her to her feet. "Milady! Are we besieged?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Abnoba... foolish child, what did you expect the rearrangement of the universe to feel like? Although doubtless the Bannor camp at our borders would take this as provocation and besiege us, and it would be to our advantage to let them face the Infernals and rip this land asunder... our spies tell us that they shall soon have to return home and face a worse surprise in the halls of Torrolerial. So we must find some other target for our new patron Hyborem."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Ashen Veil priestess smiled. "The north."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Os-Gabella beckoned. From the shadows came a Succubus. "If Hyborem has done his part from Hell, his forces should be emerging near Tempus Mor. The civil war of the Elven states should distract them enough for Hyborem to gain ground." The Succubus nodded and left the hall.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And we?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Os-Gabella smiled. "As we have ever done. Bring discord and strife until this world is unfit for the great experiment it was built for."

TEXT.English: A dusky lady in purple robes walked through the sandstorm outside the Calabim Palace. She was followed by a sand lion and a Malakim soldier holding a white banner of parlay. She was admitted to the forbidding antechamber of the palace by mocking guards, who brought her request for a meeting with their commander to Decius.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius allowed the meeting, and she was shown into his throne room. Her bodyguards and the bloodpets guarding the entrance were the only other people there. Decius said, "You are lucky that I am leading this force, lady. My patrons would not have so honored an enemy they had the advantage of. So you may speak, but I have a limit to my patience as well."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The lady nodded. "I am Talia Gosam, druid, and I come on behalf of the Overcouncil."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius raised an eyebrow. "I had thought that your council had learned the futility of its existence in the desert of Myrh. Or were you absent during the sacking of Golden Leane?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We all stand as long as one stands, and I trust you are not so foolish as to count this conflict won already. We are prepared to discuss terms with the Calabim separate from your allies."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Terms?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Talia said, "Our guide and god Lugus despises you and your wicked kin, but surely even you can see the threat posed by the Sheaim and the Infernals to the entire world! Your support for them is preventing our stopping this threat."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"What about the Svartalfar?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We would happily leave them out of this, or negotiate with them while we focus on the Infernals, but the past has proven that deals struck with Faeryl Viconia are unreliable. We can only hope that you have some measure of wisdom and honor despite your cruelty."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Cruelty? You don't know me, Talia. I am not the monster you might expect, although you will find such among my ranks, and my patrons. But I have as little use for cruelty as I do for honor. Your terms won't give me what I've already been promised, and I need not submit to righteous guardians in the process. Surely a druid understands the need to control one's own life, whatever the consequences?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Speak not to me of my calling! You are allied with those who destroy the natural order wherever they step and would set the world aflame. There is redemption for you, Decius, if you will take it, but the Sheaim must be stopped. For the sake of all life! Think of this. Repent, and the Overcouncil will ensure your survival. That is all." Talia turned and left, returning unharmed to the Malakim forces.

TEXT.English: Ethne traveled to Golden Leane to attend the meeting of the Overcouncil. Usually an envoy went in her place, but after recent gains in their mutual struggle she decided to go in person, especially to address the plight of Sheaim and Svartalfar prisoners of war. The Malakim were a good people, but their new commander Decius struck her as overly pragmatic. He deferred a great deal to Varn Gosam, however, and the Empyrean patriarch was a merciful elven man.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Chalid was at the council meeting, Varn Gosam's closest disciple, and another non-member: Varn's wife. Ethne greeted her before they formally began. "It is good to see you well, Talia. I think of you often when I hear of the destruction left in the wake of our enemies. There will be much work to do to return our land to order when we win here; perhaps you could aid our efforts in the savannah region Flauros has claimed."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Hmm? Oh, yes. These things trouble us all, of course. In fact, I will get a chance to see this area first hand as an envoy to the Calabim. They are unnatural monsters, but perhaps they can see that aiding this Hell on Erebus is not in their interest."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I'm sure you will be missed here as you travel."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"We all have our roles to fill, Ethne. Our desires cannot interfere with our goals."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I simply meant..." Ethne's voice trailed off as Talia took a seat between Varn and Decius.

TEXT.English: Decius returned to Golden Leane for the latest Overcouncil meeting. He was well used to his life, leading an army from the front lines, but he would enjoy sleeping in a bed, and the warmth of the desert. This winter seemed to be particularly harsh.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]On the road he was surprised to see a small company of the palace guard at an oasis. Then he noticed a woman meditating in the underbrush. He sent his personal guard ahead, and approached her.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I thought that you had a garden at the palace for this," he said once she noticed him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Talia smiled and rose. "Sometimes I need something a bit more wild. Varn was kind enough to assign his palace guard to keep watch for intruders, but it isn't needed. The wilds will guard me. Protection isn't what I need from my husband."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The two turned and began walking back towards the capital, the guardsmen following respectfully behind. "I have not met a druidess, before, milady, but I am surprised that you are drawn to the desert."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Talia smiled and accepted the change of subject. "The dunes and barren rocks hold no joy for me, but here and there, in oases such as this, one find plants and animals of unequaled tenacity and cunning. This is nature as beautiful as any verdant elven forest, and this is the nature that I fell in love with when I first came to this desert. These are the same qualities that I saw in Varn, and you as well, Decius."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Tenacity? I have fled from my home rather than face false charges and defend my name honorably."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Honorable rabbits do not long survive hawks. Rabbits too frightful of them, though, would starve in their burrows. You pursue what you see as right, despite the trials you face."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Very well, I accept your compliment. Will you sit in on the Council meeting?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Talia nodded.

TEXT.English: A Svartalfar spy was waiting in Os-Gabella's chambers when she retired for the night. "This game of Faeryl's may intimidate some, but it merely annoys me to have to kill so many of her spies," Os-Gabella said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I come with a message, dear friend of the Svartalfar. An opportunity. A tale of conversation overheard in the palace of a another friend. The wife of Varn Gosam, a woman of greatly divergent temperament, requests the Calabim withdrawal from our alliance. Decius declines the offer, overly politely. There is more here than diplomacy. A risk that Decius may be swayed, but as far as he has come, he has scant recourse to go back. If she were to have a moment of weakness though, it would stab at the heart of the Overcouncil."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Os-Gabella smiled. "Perhaps if we alienate Decius... make him lonely, to long for a companion, he would seek out this woman in the future. Make sure he knows his fortune depends on his allegiance to us, however."

TEXT.English: The Calabim hunters returned with unexpected prey from their patrol into the savannah at the edge of the desert of Myrh. Decius went out to meet them when they returned, to hear the reports from the Calabim's eastern front. He found the patrol stripping a woman. There was a sand lion corpse next to her that they had brought back as a trophy. Decius started to turn away; obviously there was nothing urgent to report. But he caught a glimpse of the woman's face.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Stop." The vampire hunter who held the woman didn't notice the command, though his peers stood aside. Decius shoved him roughly aside. "I said stop."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The hunter snarled. His hand twitched by the handle of his axe, but his discipline held. He stepped back and said, "This is my spoils, commander. We found this wildling at an oasis, alone but for this beast here, which I killed. Let me take her."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"This is no ordinary witch-woman; she is a Malakim noble. You will be rewarded for her bounty price. Was there anything else to report?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No commander. The settlements we had heard of have been abandoned."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius had Talia bound and taken to his tent. Shortly he returned there himself. He freed her bonds, but made a show of pointing out the silhouettes of his armed guards outside his tent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Surprising to see you again," he said. "Were you on another diplomatic quest?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. I was meditating. The cries of the natural order were agonizing, and I was distracted and subdued by your hunter. Thank you for your intervention."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It seemed a wasteful use of someone of your caliber."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"So what use do you have in mind?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius studied her for a moment. "I haven't decided. Were I to follow the ways of my adopted people, I would take what pleasures your body offers and feast on your soul. Oddly, perhaps, this holds no appeal for me, and has the downside of wasting the resource of your mind. If I would take the example of the Bannor, I would try to discern the strength of your character and fidelity of your faith, then damn or free you based on that. While good for keeping discipline, I don't see my gain in that, either."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have lived among the Bannor?" Talia said. "I have heard they are a people of unequaled zeal."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes. And blind devotion, unending war, and arrogance dressed up as virtue."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Talia crossed her arms and gazed at the ground. "I fear my Varn leads us down this path as well. He brings the Malakim into conflicts that were not ours and ignores the wisdom others bring to meetings now devoted to Lugus. He has lost balance."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I would not be so ungrateful for advisors such as you. My allies have seen fit to give me Ritualists and mages to consult, magi who think little of my interests or that of my empire. I know you care little for my survival, but at least you would be honest about it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I would never aid you while you side with the Infernal."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"They do seem to be making a mess of these lands I would claim, but I cannot oppose them now. And your little Overcouncil is too weak to win at this point. Perhaps I can peacefully keep them from my empire, or gather allies to strike them in secret at a time of my choosing."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Do you think that my husband will let you detain me for your own use?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius shrugged. "It doesn't seem he was keeping a very close eye on you. Here is my decision, then. When Varn Gosam requests your return, you may leave unharmed. If you wish to give me your voice, or any other aid, I will welcome it."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You are kinder than I would have thought." Grudging respect was all Decius gained from Talia at first, but over the coming weeks she opened up to him, as he kept news of her capture a secret from ally and foe alike. She came to admire his strength and cunning, and bask in his attention. Finally, thoughts of her home and cause slipped entirely from her, and she embraced her captor.

TEXT.English: The war was going well for the Overcouncil. Chalid took time from the front lines to bring news to Ethne.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Varn Gosam is stepping down as Speaker of the Overcouncil, and has asked me to take his place. He is going to be leaving Golden Leane on a pilgrimage with his wife."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He is abandoning the war effort? He has been a great boon to the morale of the Empyrean soldiers in the field."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He says he has found competent people to take his place, in the council halls and on the throne. There is... more to it, however. A great sadness has crept into him. He can no longer focus on work that once consumed him. It is painful to see my good friend so troubled. In an unguarded moment, he spoke of a sudden betrayal by two he had trusted, for which he somehow blames himself. I would tend to him more closely, but as you say, the war is still at hand, and I have new duties to fulfill."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne placed a hand on his shoulder. "Thank you, Chalid. I wish you well, and I shall pray for Varn to be soothed and guarded by an angel of mercy. Agares the beguiler has plans beyond what we see play out on the field, and it would ill serve us to see our friend beset by grief."

In an unguarded moment, he spoke of a sudden betrayal by two he had trusted, for which he somehow blames himself. I would tend to him more closely, but as you say, the war is still at hand, and I have new duties to fulfill."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ethne placed a hand on his shoulder. "Thank you, Chalid. I wish you well, and I shall pray for Varn to be soothed and guarded by an angel of mercy. Agares the beguiler has plans beyond what we see play out on the field, and it would ill serve us to see our friend beset by grief."

TEXT.English: The messenger found the commander in his camp. Decius was expecting news from Varn, and bid the traveler enter his tent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Hello, my friend," said the beautiful woman who entered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Talia. This is a pleasant surprise. So Varn trusts your safety in this rough country even in a war time?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Perhaps he trusts me too much. Or perhaps he is simply not mindful of me. I no longer care. The message I've left with your lieutenant-something about Paladin training. It was just an excuse that I could see you."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Milady-Talia... Varn has been consumed with his service to Lugus, but..."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"And saving the world is important, I know. I am a wretched vile woman for wanting a bit of time from our great savior!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I did not say that. Your needs are understandable. But in a time of war, feelings are irrelevant to duty."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"How will a few hours' time lose a war? Varn is not a soldier on the front lines. He is a man with his wife nearby. Why do we need to sacrifice our feelings when we are so close to each other? We could both be happy and attend our duties. And if Varn cannot see that... we could be happy." Talia put her arm on his shoulder.

TEXT.English: Talia walked unescorted from the Calabim borders through the savannah. It was early morning, and she headed towards the rising sun, towards home. Decius had just released her from a captivity that she had forgotten wasn't voluntary. He had fascinated her, and she had betrayed her husband Varn Gosam to her baser instincts. But she learned much of the man whose armies opposed hers, and she comforted herself with the thought that this information might aid her people in stopping the Calabim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Do you know how the Sea of Sorrow was named?" The voice came from the shadows of a rock formation as she passed by.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who's there? I have been granted passage as a prisoner exchange by Decius of the Calabim."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]An old crone in dusty purple robes emerged from the shadows. "There once was a great king who ruled over this land. Lord of all he would survey. His palace stood on a cliff overlooking the sea on the western edge." She paused.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Talia gave her no further prompting. "I have no time for your story. I am too long delayed from my home already." She turned away and hurried on, but found the woman ahead of her.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It is his sorrow from which this sea draws its name. A great king who had everything he asked for given. And he climbed the tower stairs to throw himself to his death in the crashing sea beneath."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"What concern is this of mine? Kings come and go; all creatures suffer. I must return to my people, who struggle with a threat to every living thing under the sun!" The dust around her feet rose swirling around her, cutting off the old woman, and again Talia turned towards home.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This time she saw the woman step from thin air in front of her. "What caused a sorrow so great to make him disdain his own life? Do you not know the story?" The Crone looked into Talia's eyes, who this time held her gaze. "That which he most treasured was shown to be false. A promise shown a lie. A wife shown untrue."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Spirit be gone! Do not... do not judge me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"The king's greatest desire was for his trusted queen to stand loyally by his side and help him to rule justly. He was too kind to send her away, too wise to trust her again, too idealistic to live with his dream out of reach. His death was the only solution within his grasp."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"It would be better had he never learned of this," Talia said softly.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He will learn of it," the Crone said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He should... he can take another."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"He is too true to do that. The king could not be happy... not while the queen who betrayed him still lived."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The old woman turned away, releasing Talia from her gaze. Talia shook her head, then turned away, running towards home.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The crone's ancient façade faded away. She removed a small mirror from her robes, and sprinkled a powder over it, revealing a dreary castle in a hellish landscape. "The seeds are planted, Lethe. Follow this one. Take her guilt and pain as supplication, and lead her to your embrace."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Then after one final look to the fleeing Talia, Os-Gabella spoke a arcane command and returned to her palace.

TEXT.English: The Malakim soldiers fell silent when they saw who came into their war camp. Heads were bowed before Varn Gosam, the elf who had united them and shown them the light of their purpose. Varn Gosam smiled, speaking briefly with a few men before making his way to Decius's tent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius looked up when Varn entered. He paused a moment, then said, "Varn, welcome. It is good to see you here. You should be safe, the tide of battle favors us, and seeing you will lift morale."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Yes, that is so. I will be sure to speak to them before leaving. But I came because I had to see you in person. I have a task to charge you with," Varn said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Much depends on the task I face here, my friend. I should not leave it until complete."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have served well, in your official capacity, and I must ask for more of you. I am stepping down, for a while, at least. I have taken too much upon myself. Our goals are great, and require great effort. But they are so great they are beyond any one man, and as we have set the wheels in motion I must take some time for my own life."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Then my role?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Take the lead of the Malakim. You have made an excellent general, and the men of the desert honor you for your skills and devotion. For a while, I ask that you guide the civil affairs of our people as well. Have a mage attend you, and use divination to communicate with the council in Golden Leane. This will take some of your time from here, but you should have competent commanders you can promote to lead from the front."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius nodded. "I will do this for you. So you will devote yourself to Lugus's work on the Overcouncil?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. Chalid has been attending the council meetings with me, and he shall take over as Speaker in my stead. Vaughn will return to Dies Dei and take the mantle of Patriarch."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Very well. May I ask what prompted this retirement?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Varn shook as head and turned to leave, then paused with his back to Decius. "We preach openness, I so suppose it should not go unsaid. Your recent actions when my Talia was visiting here have demonstrated how much I was failing my other obligations. It was my hubris to think that I could cause no harm while pursuing the good with such dedication. The same mistake made by the priesthood that so failed you, I suppose. The marital bond that sustained me I neglected; now I must see if it can be made strong anew. Take care, Decius, and take care of my people."

But I came because I had to see you in person. I have a task to charge you with," Varn said.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Much depends on the task I face here, my friend. I should not leave it until complete."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"You have served well, in your official capacity, and I must ask for more of you. I am stepping down, for a while, at least. I have taken too much upon myself. Our goals are great, and require great effort. But they are so great they are beyond any one man, and as we have set the wheels in motion I must take some time for my own life."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Then my role?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Take the lead of the Malakim. You have made an excellent general, and the men of the desert honor you for your skills and devotion. For a while, I ask that you guide the civil affairs of our people as well. Have a mage attend you, and use divination to communicate with the council in Golden Leane. This will take some of your time from here, but you should have competent commanders you can promote to lead from the front."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Decius nodded. "I will do this for you. So you will devote yourself to Lugus's work on the Overcouncil?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"No. Chalid has been attending the council meetings with me, and he shall take over as Speaker in my stead. Vaughn will return to Dies Dei and take the mantle of Patriarch."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Very well. May I ask what prompted this retirement?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Varn shook as head and turned to leave, then paused with his back to Decius. "We preach openness, I so suppose it should not go unsaid. Your recent actions when my Talia was visiting here have demonstrated how much I was failing my other obligations. It was my hubris to think that I could cause no harm while pursuing the good with such dedication. The same mistake made by the priesthood that so failed you, I suppose. The marital bond that sustained me I neglected; now I must see if it can be made strong anew. Take care, Decius, and take care of my people."
